commit_message:
TODO Item for integration with Glare

The Glare service is finally out. We may want to integrate with it for
the storage of profiles and policies. At least, senlin should be able to
retrieve heat templates from glare when needed.

Change-Id: I22b82d108fdc5c63524c11703982ab63e335c641

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-05-15 18:24:58.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/auth_password.py', 'heat/common/context.py'], 'message': "Standalone heat can't specify a region

This change modifies the auth_password middleware to check for a
X-Region-Name header in the request. If it exists then it passes it to
the keystoneclient object so the correct endpoint can be determined.

Change-Id: I3d29130bfd20d8137566f9de7fc51d48d618fd7b
Closes-Bug: #1223068
"}]
commit_message:
Standalone heat can't specify a region

This change modifies the auth_password middleware to check for a
X-Region-Name header in the request. If it exists then it passes it to
the keystoneclient object so the correct endpoint can be determined.

Change-Id: I3d29130bfd20d8137566f9de7fc51d48d618fd7b
Closes-Bug: #1223068

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-07-19 22:27:10.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/common/metrics.py'], 'message': "Add log.exception to get more info

Also report the actual value in the log message to
help debugging later on.
Removed 'raise e' because we don't want to raise an
exception in sample() and lose the metrics after it

Change-Id: I9f9cbc492ef17a484cfefca1188d295c490d8578
"}]
commit_message:
Add log.exception to get more info

Also report the actual value in the log message to
help debugging later on.
Removed 'raise e' because we don't want to raise an
exception in sample() and lose the metrics after it

Change-Id: I9f9cbc492ef17a484cfefca1188d295c490d8578

commit_message:
Move dsvm jobs from kuryr to kuryr-libnetwork

This patch removes following jobs from kuryr repo:
        - gate-install-dsvm-kuryr
        - gate-kuryr-dsvm-fullstack-nv
        - gate-kuryr-dsvm-rally-nv

And adds following jobs in the "check" pipeline of kuryr-libnetwork
repo:
        - gate-install-dsvm-kuryr-nv
        - gate-kuryr-dsvm-fullstack-nv
        - gate-kuryr-dsvm-rally-nv
        - gate-kuryr-libnetwork-python34

Relevant discussion can be found here,
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/kuryr/2016/kuryr.2016-07-18-14.05.html

Change-Id: Id522a199ff5b210bc35f78ec8ce07305381d888f

subject: Add check on docker_volume_size
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-07-20 08:14:01.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/userguide.rst', 'doc/source/dev/tls.rst', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/baymodel.py', 'magnum/api/validation.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_baymodel.py'], 'message': 'Add check on docker_volume_size

In magnum server side, docker_volume_size allowed minimum value is 1GB.
In fact, the minimum value should be 3GB when docker-storage-driver is
devicemapper, because the limitation of docker-storage-setup. So, I add
check on "--docker-volume-size". If "--docker-storage-driver=devicemapper",
the minimum docker-volume-size should be 3GB, otherwise it should 1GB.

Change-Id: I53c6a9c93ee156fa9afabdbd72a87bb4044d71ca
Closes-Bug: #1583878
'}]
commit_message:
Add check on docker_volume_size

In magnum server side, docker_volume_size allowed minimum value is 1GB.
In fact, the minimum value should be 3GB when docker-storage-driver is
devicemapper, because the limitation of docker-storage-setup. So, I add
check on "--docker-volume-size". If "--docker-storage-driver=devicemapper",
the minimum docker-volume-size should be 3GB, otherwise it should 1GB.

Change-Id: I53c6a9c93ee156fa9afabdbd72a87bb4044d71ca
Closes-Bug: #1583878

commit_message:
Don't report operator data to customer

libvirt plugin was improperly combining tenant and operator dimensions when
sending data to the tenant.  Now only use the tenant dimensions when sending to
the tenant and only operator dimensions when sending to the operator.

Change-Id: I8d850446a5059c5767623b26c63b7d9df8fefcbb
Closes-Bug: #1604933

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-07-19 18:34:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_trunk.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/models.py', 'neutron/objects/trunk.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/rules.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/services/network/json/network_client.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/constants.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'neutron/extensions/trunk.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_trunk_negative.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/expand/5abc0278ca73_add_support_for_vlan_trunking.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Add new attributes to trunk model

This patch adds the following attributes to the trunk model:

  * name: this is added for convenience, especially to speed
    up resource lookup via CLI commands. This is also added
    for consistency with other Neutron resources.
  * admin_state_up: this is added for management needs. There
    may be maintenance situations where preventing the user
    from adding/removing subports to a trunk while in disabled
    state is desired.
  * status: this can be used to track the aggregate status
    of all the resources (parent + subports) participating
    into a trunk.

The API extension is modified accordingly, coverage added.
The hash for the trunk object is revised, while the object
version is left as is, since all of this is still unreleased.

The patch leaves the logic to handle the trunk status aggregation
to be added at a later date, whilst minor refactoring
improves readability and use of the database sessions.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: Ibe39378d43b1d63c2b006c2da574f52d9934a0df
'}]
commit_message:
Add new attributes to trunk model

This patch adds the following attributes to the trunk model:

  * name: this is added for convenience, especially to speed
    up resource lookup via CLI commands. This is also added
    for consistency with other Neutron resources.
  * admin_state_up: this is added for management needs. There
    may be maintenance situations where preventing the user
    from adding/removing subports to a trunk while in disabled
    state is desired.
  * status: this can be used to track the aggregate status
    of all the resources (parent + subports) participating
    into a trunk.

The API extension is modified accordingly, coverage added.
The hash for the trunk object is revised, while the object
version is left as is, since all of this is still unreleased.

The patch leaves the logic to handle the trunk status aggregation
to be added at a later date, whilst minor refactoring
improves readability and use of the database sessions.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: Ibe39378d43b1d63c2b006c2da574f52d9934a0df

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-27 06:11:30.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/auth/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Error in get revoke_list

When we do the action, GET /auth/tokens/OS-PKI/revoked, the following
things occur:
   ERROR in keystone.common.wsgi'str', object has no attribute 'strftime',
and the real reason is that "expires" is a string not a time or datetime
type. For 'expires' in token generates from 'datetime' type.

Change-Id: If77e44dd62176cf935aa1a81336a132bb676b78a
'}]
commit_message:
Error in get revoke_list

When we do the action, GET /auth/tokens/OS-PKI/revoked, the following
things occur:
   ERROR in keystone.common.wsgi'str', object has no attribute 'strftime',
and the real reason is that "expires" is a string not a time or datetime
type. For 'expires' in token generates from 'datetime' type.

Change-Id: If77e44dd62176cf935aa1a81336a132bb676b78a

[1] If83e66d4b2f0f1db181e7c23ac256c498566c2da

commit_message:
Register apps in unit tests properly

Patch [1] that was fixing unit tests breakage did it in wrong way.
Dashboard apps stopped being registered and it became impossible to
verify URL-based behaviour in case we try to run subset of tests.

So, fix it explicitly registering apps in proper order.

[1] If83e66d4b2f0f1db181e7c23ac256c498566c2da

Change-Id: I25de9f49c58ad0b34e4b5bafdc8082fa173c448f
Closes-Bug: #1604809

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-08 07:18:01.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/selectability-for-translator.rst'], 'message': "Adds selectability for translators in PollingDataSource class

PollingDataSource class polls all data from related services once
the DataSource is initialized. If the polling spends long time
to fetch the data, even though any policy rule doesn't use some
of the DataSource's translator, it causes performance issue.

This spec resolves the performance issue by diasbling translator
to poll data.

blueprint selectable-translator

Change-Id: Ie00cf5a8f8fc160de62d2013c4fb6113b6ba624f
"}]
commit_message:
Adds selectability for translators in PollingDataSource class

PollingDataSource class polls all data from related services once
the DataSource is initialized. If the polling spends long time
to fetch the data, even though any policy rule doesn't use some
of the DataSource's translator, it causes performance issue.

This spec resolves the performance issue by diasbling translator
to poll data.

blueprint selectable-translator

Change-Id: Ie00cf5a8f8fc160de62d2013c4fb6113b6ba624f

subject: Fix packaging problems for Debian
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-19 05:12:23.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debootstrap/root.d/08-debootstrap', 'elements/debian-minimal/environment.d/10-debian-minimal.bash', 'elements/debian-minimal/test-elements/stable-build-succeeds/environment.d/10-set-distro.bash', 'elements/debian-minimal/test-elements/testing-build-succeeds/README.rst', 'elements/debian-minimal/test-elements/testing-build-succeeds/environment.d/10-set-distro.bash', 'elements/debian-minimal/element-deps', 'tests/run_functests.sh', 'elements/debian-minimal/package-installs.yaml', 'elements/debian-minimal/test-elements/stable-build-succeeds/README.rst', 'elements/debian-minimal/pkg-map'], 'message': "Fix packaging problems for Debian

This patch solves three issues with Debian packaging / apt:

o When building 'testing' only default apt sources is
  included - backports, updates and security are skipped because they
  do not exists.

o The default release for Debian was `unstable`: this is now fixed to
  `stable`.

o Starting a Debian Stretch VM that was build with diskimage-builder
  does not work, because some mandatory packages are missing.
  This patch fixes this problem: it adds the mandatory packages and
  the test case.

Change-Id: If49b5b162c4da1e074e9b19324839bc59d87dc57
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix packaging problems for Debian

This patch solves three issues with Debian packaging / apt:

o When building 'testing' only default apt sources is
  included - backports, updates and security are skipped because they
  do not exists.

o The default release for Debian was `unstable`: this is now fixed to
  `stable`.

o Starting a Debian Stretch VM that was build with diskimage-builder
  does not work, because some mandatory packages are missing.
  This patch fixes this problem: it adds the mandatory packages and
  the test case.

Change-Id: If49b5b162c4da1e074e9b19324839bc59d87dc57
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Bump service version for BuildRequest deletion

This service version indicates that the successful delete of a
BuildRequest during instance deletion will cause nova-conductor to stop
a build when it notices that the BuildRequest is gone. This simplifies
the delete code for dealing with pre-scheduled instances.

Change-Id: I961d002cccd3e01a26cb5174e0804db7fc1f836d

commit_message:
Changing debug log format

This is part of multiple patches to change the way we do
debug logging.

comments on some of the changes:
base_http_client looks cluttered with the debug_log decorator
and the HttpClient class, so split it into two and now the
logger is in its on file.

Change-Id: I49faa0a0ab92b25446e5047dfa039ecbdf400b6a

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-07-12 17:39:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/service.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Stop instance build if BuildRequest deleted

As part of the cellsv2 instance boot process there is a check that the
BuildRequest still exists before sending the request to a compute. This
is how an instance delete for an unscheduled booting instance will stop
the boot from proceeding.

However if there are some older nova-api services then the BuildRequest
may not have ever existed so it's non-existence does not indicate a
delete occurred. A service version check accounts for this and lets the
build proceed as normal. In that case the delete code will also need to
account for the lower service version and clean up the instance from the
cell.

Change-Id: Id65ab1911071608a739bea96e071939baa388493
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction
"}]
commit_message:
Stop instance build if BuildRequest deleted

As part of the cellsv2 instance boot process there is a check that the
BuildRequest still exists before sending the request to a compute. This
is how an instance delete for an unscheduled booting instance will stop
the boot from proceeding.

However if there are some older nova-api services then the BuildRequest
may not have ever existed so it's non-existence does not indicate a
delete occurred. A service version check accounts for this and lets the
build proceed as normal. In that case the delete code will also need to
account for the lower service version and clean up the instance from the
cell.

Change-Id: Id65ab1911071608a739bea96e071939baa388493
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction

subject: DVR: Fix allowed_address_pair port binding with delayed fip
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10692, 'name': 'Brocade Vyatta CI', 'email': 'DL-GRP-VYATTA-OSS@Brocade.com', 'username': 'brocade-oss-service', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-13 19:43:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py'], 'message': "DVR: Fix allowed_address_pair port binding with delayed fip

Today when allowed_address_pairs are configured on a dvr
service port and if a floatingip is associated with the
allowed_address_pair port, we inherit the dvr service port's
host and the device_owner to which the port is associated.

But when the floatingip is created on the allowed_address_pair
port after the port is associated with a dvr service port, then
we apply the right port host binding and the arp_update.

This patch address the issue, by checking for the host binding
when there is a new floatingip configured. If host binding is
missing and if the port happens to be an allowed_address_pair
port, then it checks for the associated service port and if there
is a single valid and active service port, then it inherits the
host binding and device owner from the dvr service port and also
applies the right arp entry. If there is are more than one
active ports, then it returns.

Closes-Bug: #1569918
(cherry picked from commit 3a5315ef8dbc6265ad2c47eebc1e2c42722a7cb4)

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py
Change-Id: I80a299d3f99113f77d2e728c3d9e000d01dacebd
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: Fix allowed_address_pair port binding with delayed fip

Today when allowed_address_pairs are configured on a dvr
service port and if a floatingip is associated with the
allowed_address_pair port, we inherit the dvr service port's
host and the device_owner to which the port is associated.

But when the floatingip is created on the allowed_address_pair
port after the port is associated with a dvr service port, then
we apply the right port host binding and the arp_update.

This patch address the issue, by checking for the host binding
when there is a new floatingip configured. If host binding is
missing and if the port happens to be an allowed_address_pair
port, then it checks for the associated service port and if there
is a single valid and active service port, then it inherits the
host binding and device owner from the dvr service port and also
applies the right arp entry. If there is are more than one
active ports, then it returns.

Closes-Bug: #1569918
(cherry picked from commit 3a5315ef8dbc6265ad2c47eebc1e2c42722a7cb4)

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py
Change-Id: I80a299d3f99113f77d2e728c3d9e000d01dacebd

commit_message:
Remove the _is_v2 and _is_v3 helpers

We've finally got to the point where tokens are abstracted to the point
where we don't actually need to test by content what version of token it
is. Rejoice and remove the helpers.

Change-Id: Ia968ea68a9731c2a8f6a120acf697b30a2fcef8b

commit_message:
Change all test URLs to use example.com

The tests in novaclient/tests/unit/test_client.py use several domain
names other than example.com, which should always be used to avoid
conflict with actual domains. These include foo.com, blah.com, and
nooooooooo.com, all of which are legitimate owned domain names. These
have been replaced with example.com usages.

Closes-bug 1555682

Change-Id: I6573e118364300cd09653b87df28ba1a95870d3c

commit_message:
Add 'totp' as a valid choice for credential type

Keystone already has a merged module that supports single use
TOTP tokens for login and as such the OpenStack Client should
support the creation of a credential type of 'totp'.

Change-Id: I7c95fdf2d92cd3cf6a289904dca376b6d63f08e6

This is part of a process to make the placement API more independent
of nova tooling.

* There is no longer a command to run the placement service, it only
  runs under a WSGI container (such as mod wsgi).
* There is a separate api-paste.ini file for the placement API
* Nova's noauth middleware and authorization handling have been
  duplicated and changed so that that they work with the placement
  CONF and use the olso forms of utilities instead of the
  nova originals.

Partially-Implements: generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I84f616503437b34f03e00d401c63679c8fc62896
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Make placement-api WSGI only with its own paste file

This is part of a process to make the placement API more independent
of nova tooling.

* There is no longer a command to run the placement service, it only
  runs under a WSGI container (such as mod wsgi).
* There is a separate api-paste.ini file for the placement API
* Nova's noauth middleware and authorization handling have been
  duplicated and changed so that that they work with the placement
  CONF and use the olso forms of utilities instead of the
  nova originals.

Partially-Implements: generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I84f616503437b34f03e00d401c63679c8fc62896

commit_message:
Show Adolfo what I mean

Concerning RPC backends and how to decouple things using the registry.

The trunk plugin may have an RPC interface that may be needed by any
of the agent-based drivers plugging in, and be used to talk to the
Server. Furthermore they may add specific server side behavior as
necessary.

Change-Id: Id403a5cb9dc903fa97851a0579ddbe342179dccb

This makes the libvirt driver use instance.flavor.root_gb instead
of the legacy instance.root_gb field (and friends).

Also, this fixes a bunch of bugs in tests where the incorrect
value of memory in megabytes was being compared to the actual
result in kilobytes from the config generation code. This was
not detected before because of multiply-by-zero.

Change-Id: I23415edb0347741690fe8fcc75cdc2f3d83be4fc
'}]
commit_message:
Make libvirt driver use flavor fields instead of legacy ones

This makes the libvirt driver use instance.flavor.root_gb instead
of the legacy instance.root_gb field (and friends).

Also, this fixes a bunch of bugs in tests where the incorrect
value of memory in megabytes was being compared to the actual
result in kilobytes from the config generation code. This was
not detected before because of multiply-by-zero.

Change-Id: I23415edb0347741690fe8fcc75cdc2f3d83be4fc

commit_message:
Generalize agent extension mechanism

This change generalizes agent extension code so that all agents can take
advantage of a common mechanism.

Co-Authored-By: Margaret Frances <margaret_frances@cable.comcast.com>

Partially-Implements: blueprint l3-agent-extensions

Change-Id: I9380343c09d28eec67077c9e6d77c33a195e516b

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-18 14:50:46.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_setup/detection/plugins/mon.py'], 'message': 'Eliminate use of hard-coded persister admin type/port

The http healthcheck for the Monasca persister was configured using
hard-coded type/port values of http/8091 instead of using the values
specified in the yaml configuration file. This change replaces the
hard-coded values with what is specified in the configuration file
if available, otherwise default values of http/8091 are used.

Change-Id: Ie29b7a12dfd7b71868a250ee906c98b92decf26e
'}]
commit_message:
Eliminate use of hard-coded persister admin type/port

The http healthcheck for the Monasca persister was configured using
hard-coded type/port values of http/8091 instead of using the values
specified in the yaml configuration file. This change replaces the
hard-coded values with what is specified in the configuration file
if available, otherwise default values of http/8091 are used.

Change-Id: Ie29b7a12dfd7b71868a250ee906c98b92decf26e

commit_message:
Dell SC: Specify High Availability for create replication

No SyncMode was being specified. This defaults the SyncMode to
High Consistency. This patch changes it to High Availability.

Change-Id: Idaa8f4f9a4d1914da99caeb8a49e4740e4d9e68b
Closes-Bug: #1596680

commit_message:
Expose 'requires_id' to get_xxx proxy functions

This patch proposes to relax the constraints on the get() call
interface: we should permit a resource get operation without providing
an ID.

Change-Id: Ic45b04736a7e35f9f57d2f8f0b08675d0c02da8c

commit_message:
Revert "Only build venvs for services which are deployed"

This reverts commit 37eb0de57b97268f7c9368edcd35af0a3af73e10.

Reverting as it results in tempest_venv not getting built. The group membership logic needs some more work.

Change-Id: I6fdfa3ceab627438bad08b7204c7612014de2878

commit_message:
Allow unique keys to be used with get_object

This patch adds 'unique_keys' to NeutronDbObject and allows get_object
to lookup objects by unique keys in addition to primary keys.

Change-Id: I31f5603c116892390d1f8025d3c1893355ad0bac
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Config option update tasks for availability_zone

Removed the "Services which consume this:" sections per [0].
Also removed the "Related options" sections that do not contain
any information.

Also, since there are no deprecated options the
"check_deprecation_status" flag has been removed as well.

 [0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ConfigOptionsConsistency

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I2c2cf1e90ce9ca84834a6aeffeb69a885c7e57e1

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-12 15:37:19.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron'], 'message': "Neutron: include metering service plugin in conf

The common code for metering calls _neutron_service_plugin_class_add,
which despite the description only just appends a service plugin to
$Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES - it doesn't actually write it into a
configuration file.

So for now, read out the configuration, and append metering to it, then
write it back out.

Change-Id: Ice96cca8b43dcd54f2aa81461000a4597db8260d
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron: include metering service plugin in conf

The common code for metering calls _neutron_service_plugin_class_add,
which despite the description only just appends a service plugin to
$Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES - it doesn't actually write it into a
configuration file.

So for now, read out the configuration, and append metering to it, then
write it back out.

Change-Id: Ice96cca8b43dcd54f2aa81461000a4597db8260d

Fix outdated parameter network_info description in virt/driver

We can get instance's network_info from neutron or nova-network,
a link to method in nova-network is meaningless.

commit_message:
Stop import datasource manager in plexxi driver and harness

In dse2 datasource manager doesn't exist but plexxi driver and harness
imports and uses the module and class method. This patch prevents the
the files from import and use the module.

Change-Id: Iae1fc34f1dac60c915c8ce418087203f286c7df7

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-20 09:51:31.000000000', 'files': ['octane/handlers/upgrade/controller.py'], 'message': 'Remove leftover neutron restart from controller post-deploy stage

Since neutron.conf file is not updated anymore with valid value
of nova_admin_tenant_id, the restart of neutron server in post
deployment stage of upgrade operation is not needed.

Remove command that restarts neutron server.

Change-Id: I4e2ebe49221c0d0f02609d68cb343e2a707c5bad
Related-bug: 1584746
(cherry picked from commit c01c4d92d343745e136cbafc233e336f5fcef5f2)'}]
commit_message:
Remove leftover neutron restart from controller post-deploy stage

Since neutron.conf file is not updated anymore with valid value
of nova_admin_tenant_id, the restart of neutron server in post
deployment stage of upgrade operation is not needed.

Remove command that restarts neutron server.

Change-Id: I4e2ebe49221c0d0f02609d68cb343e2a707c5bad
Related-bug: 1584746
(cherry picked from commit c01c4d92d343745e136cbafc233e336f5fcef5f2)

commit_message:
Add cpu.time_ns for owning tenant

Most of the libvirt metrics are from both owning tenant and
operations tenant. In this review, cpu.time_ns metric from owning
tenant is added. So we have both cpu.time_ns and vm.cpu.time_ns

Speed up Searchlight indexing

To speed up Searchlight indexing and re-indexing
we should use threads instead of inexing resource
types sequentially.

subject: Remove get_user_id in trust controller
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-14 08:30:13.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/trust/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_auth.py'], 'message': 'Remove get_user_id in trust controller

The get_user_id function relied on the token model in auth_context -
which amongst other things means it would fail with a tokenless auth
context. This can be replaced with user_id from the request.context.

Normally I try not to mix in cleanups, but whilst doing this and
changing variables in list_trusts a small reshuffle and some whitespace
just made the whole thing actually readable.

Change-Id: I5b64210fc797961b422a0ab9a1b4cee078fe6a0f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove get_user_id in trust controller

The get_user_id function relied on the token model in auth_context -
which amongst other things means it would fail with a tokenless auth
context. This can be replaced with user_id from the request.context.

Normally I try not to mix in cleanups, but whilst doing this and
changing variables in list_trusts a small reshuffle and some whitespace
just made the whole thing actually readable.

Change-Id: I5b64210fc797961b422a0ab9a1b4cee078fe6a0f

subject: Use more specific asserts in test/unit/common/ring
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-15 13:28:34.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/ring/test_builder.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_ring.py'], 'message': 'Use more specific asserts in test/unit/common/ring

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type)
or assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I9531c9939aa7c2dac127b5dc865b8d396dab318f
'}]
commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in test/unit/common/ring

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type)
or assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I9531c9939aa7c2dac127b5dc865b8d396dab318f

subject: Only build venvs for services which are deployed
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-07-20 15:04:58.000000000', 'files': ['tests/inventory', 'releasenotes/notes/selective-venv-build-dd9f0e40cd1cc076.yaml', 'templates/op-venv-script.sh.j2', 'tests/test-repo-build.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml'], 'message': "Only build venvs for services which are deployed

The current repo build process builds venvs for all OpenStack services,
regardless of whether they're actually going to be used.

To reduce the repo build time, this patch will only build venvs for
OpenStack services where there is one or more members in the service
inventory group.

Change-Id: If966de6f2b8d972e9addc3385b8de5c13a986cc1
"}]
commit_message:
Only build venvs for services which are deployed

The current repo build process builds venvs for all OpenStack services,
regardless of whether they're actually going to be used.

To reduce the repo build time, this patch will only build venvs for
OpenStack services where there is one or more members in the service
inventory group.

Change-Id: If966de6f2b8d972e9addc3385b8de5c13a986cc1

commit_message:
Rename DB columns: tenant -> project

All occurences of ``tenant_id`` across the neutron database are
being renamed to ``project_id``.

This neutron-fwaas change accompanies the neutron change:
I87a8ef342ccea004731ba0192b23a8e79bc382dc

Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

subject: WIP - Create firewall_rules from an Hiera Hash
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-07 13:20:08.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/firewall.pp'], 'message': "WIP - Create firewall_rules from an Hiera Hash

Using hiera_hash will allow us to merge the value of firewall_rules that
can be defined in TripleO composable services, so we'll be able to
define Firewall rules in Hiera.

Note: we're using native merging here [1] as a first iteration, as we
don't need to override Firewall rules for now. We can change that later
if we actually need it.

[1] https://docs.puppet.com/hiera/3.2/lookup_types.html#native-merging

Change-Id: I7057af6c9aa15244363351b76d79a74071542b78
"}]
commit_message:
WIP - Create firewall_rules from an Hiera Hash

Using hiera_hash will allow us to merge the value of firewall_rules that
can be defined in TripleO composable services, so we'll be able to
define Firewall rules in Hiera.

Note: we're using native merging here [1] as a first iteration, as we
don't need to override Firewall rules for now. We can change that later
if we actually need it.

[1] https://docs.puppet.com/hiera/3.2/lookup_types.html#native-merging

Change-Id: I7057af6c9aa15244363351b76d79a74071542b78

subject: Move Keystone and Neutron Server firewall rules into the service
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-19 13:35:12.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/services/services.yaml', 'puppet/services/neutron-server.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'puppet/services/keystone.yaml', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': "Move Keystone and Neutron Server firewall rules into the service

Define the Firewall rules for Keystone and Neutron Server directly in the service using
Hiera. A patch in puppet-tripleo (See dependency) will use hiera_hash to
merge the value of all firewall_rules and apply them.

Note: we don't touch HAproxy rules as they need some logic.
They'll be implemented in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330785/ .

Change-Id: I813a0dd2a05c706d2fe7ceab0d1b86068e190599
Depends-On: I7057af6c9aa15244363351b76d79a74071542b78
"}]
commit_message:
Move Keystone and Neutron Server firewall rules into the service

Define the Firewall rules for Keystone and Neutron Server directly in the service using
Hiera. A patch in puppet-tripleo (See dependency) will use hiera_hash to
merge the value of all firewall_rules and apply them.

Note: we don't touch HAproxy rules as they need some logic.
They'll be implemented in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330785/ .

Change-Id: I813a0dd2a05c706d2fe7ceab0d1b86068e190599
Depends-On: I7057af6c9aa15244363351b76d79a74071542b78

subject: Allow metric logger to be invalidated if needed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 18:33:54.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_lib/metrics_utils.py'], 'message': 'Allow metric logger to be invalidated if needed

In some cases, a metric logger may need to be reconfigured on the
fly, such as when IPA recieves metrics configurations from the conductor
on startup.

This permits the metric logger to be invalidated as needed while still
being cached otherwise.

Usage for this should follow:

import metrics_utils from ironic_lib

@metrics_utils.get_metrics_logger(__name__)
def blah()
    return

Change-Id: I4019fa6d64d4e261d3b08048c7de139913c3e1e2
Related-bug: 1526219
'}]
commit_message:
Allow metric logger to be invalidated if needed

In some cases, a metric logger may need to be reconfigured on the
fly, such as when IPA recieves metrics configurations from the conductor
on startup.

This permits the metric logger to be invalidated as needed while still
being cached otherwise.

Usage for this should follow:

import metrics_utils from ironic_lib

@metrics_utils.get_metrics_logger(__name__)
def blah()
    return

Change-Id: I4019fa6d64d4e261d3b08048c7de139913c3e1e2
Related-bug: 1526219

subject: Enable translations for vmware-nsx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 18:34:53.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Enable translations for vmware-nsx

As per [1], project translations are enabled via the 'translate'
option in projects.yaml. While we recently fixed a translation
sync bug [2] for vmware-nsx, we are not seeing the incoming
translation patches as per [1].

commit_message:
Enable translations for vmware-nsx

As per [1], project translations are enabled via the 'translate'
option in projects.yaml. While we recently fixed a translation
sync bug [2] for vmware-nsx, we are not seeing the incoming
translation patches as per [1].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Translations/Infrastructure
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/vmware-nsx/+bug/1568706

Change-Id: Idf2553b0fc0811b8c5fca7d444db1047a25bd9ea

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-12 07:27:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/migration/__init__.py'], 'message': "Add function to remove constraints from database

Function used in alembic database migration script to
remove foreign keys from table doesn't remove unique constraint
created for such fk in table.
Sometimes there is need to remove also such unique constraint during
database upgrade.
Removing unique constraint is little bit different in mysql and
postgresql databases because names of such constraints are different.
This patch introduces function to remove constraints from table
during migration.
It is also used in remove_fks_from_table() function to allow removal
unique constraints when fk is removed.

Change-Id: I7e7732560984b1c1e45230434ddc4be8cf5ab630
Closes-Bug: #1599840
"}]
commit_message:
Add function to remove constraints from database

Function used in alembic database migration script to
remove foreign keys from table doesn't remove unique constraint
created for such fk in table.
Sometimes there is need to remove also such unique constraint during
database upgrade.
Removing unique constraint is little bit different in mysql and
postgresql databases because names of such constraints are different.
This patch introduces function to remove constraints from table
during migration.
It is also used in remove_fks_from_table() function to allow removal
unique constraints when fk is removed.

Change-Id: I7e7732560984b1c1e45230434ddc4be8cf5ab630
Closes-Bug: #1599840

commit_message:
Creating Ocata specs directory

This week is the deadline for Newton specs so I'm creating the Ocata
directory.

To get around the chicken and egg problem of having a dummy spec in
the Ocata directory, I'm using the same technique that Nova adopted in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127047

verifies Glance signatures associated with base
images stored in the libvirt driver's image cache.

[{'number': 88, 'created': '2016-07-19 21:20:48.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud-configs/net-config-multinode.json.template', 'scripts/common_functions.sh', 'scripts/tripleo.sh', 'scripts/bootstrap-overcloud-full.sh', 'test-environments/multinode.yaml', 'scripts/deploy.sh', 'toci_gate_test.sh', 'toci_instack_multinode.sh', 'heat-templates/net-config-multinode.yaml'], 'message': 'Add mulitnode CI job support to tripleo-ci

This would allow using multinode jobs spawned by nodepool, but that is
not the only use case. Any cloud provider could be used by this setup,
including a 3rd party CI setup.

The scripts here are modified to support installing the undercloud
directly on the node running the toci_gate_test.sh script, which is
often the jenkins slave. When deploying an all in one Overcloud this
results in needing 2 nodes total to do the basic TripleO deployment.

There is a new script named toci_instack_multinode.sh to run the
multinode setup.

Change-Id: Icc67a289df207348536c0a2419b3fc81f03fe758
'}]
commit_message:
Add mulitnode CI job support to tripleo-ci

This would allow using multinode jobs spawned by nodepool, but that is
not the only use case. Any cloud provider could be used by this setup,
including a 3rd party CI setup.

The scripts here are modified to support installing the undercloud
directly on the node running the toci_gate_test.sh script, which is
often the jenkins slave. When deploying an all in one Overcloud this
results in needing 2 nodes total to do the basic TripleO deployment.

There is a new script named toci_instack_multinode.sh to run the
multinode setup.

Change-Id: Icc67a289df207348536c0a2419b3fc81f03fe758

subject: Share _get_random_uuid() among all tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 12:23:20.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/tests/test_coordination.py', 'tooz/tests/__init__.py', 'tooz/tests/test_memcache.py', 'tooz/tests/test_postgresql.py', 'tooz/tests/test_mysql.py', 'tooz/tests/drivers/test_file.py'], 'message': "Share _get_random_uuid() among all tests

Currently, _get_random_uuid() is defined in test_coordination.py as a
staticmethod. This in turn forces multiple test suites to either use
that function from test_coordination (which was not done), or
re-implement the function on each call (which was done).

This patch proposes a move of the said function to tests/__init__.py,
which will allow every module to simply invoke
'tooz.tests.get_random_uuid()' if they wanted a random uuid. This will
eliminate a lot of code duplication in the test suite.

Change-Id: Idfc50d9da23790613d30bd87fb4da8eb272dce1f
"}]
commit_message:
Share _get_random_uuid() among all tests

Currently, _get_random_uuid() is defined in test_coordination.py as a
staticmethod. This in turn forces multiple test suites to either use
that function from test_coordination (which was not done), or
re-implement the function on each call (which was done).

This patch proposes a move of the said function to tests/__init__.py,
which will allow every module to simply invoke
'tooz.tests.get_random_uuid()' if they wanted a random uuid. This will
eliminate a lot of code duplication in the test suite.

Change-Id: Idfc50d9da23790613d30bd87fb4da8eb272dce1f

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-18 22:09:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': 'Add RouterPort binding to ha interface creation

The L3 HA interface cleanup routines during router deletion were
occuring after the parent router resource was deleted. This meant
that if they failed to delete, they would be orphaned since the
parent router was already gone.

This order of router delete and then HA delete was intentional
because deleting them before calling the parent router delete
function would cause them to be deleted before the checks to see
if the router was in use. If the router was in use, the HA interface
would be removed and would leave an HA router in an inconsitent state.
(See I956d0094ae6e2412e859d79feeb4003941d2bb4b for details)

This patch just has the L3 HA code add a RouterPort binding for the
HA interfaces. This allows the parent router_delete call to delete the
HA interfaces automatically after doing the in-use check but before
deleting the actual router.

In order to avoid a migration in a back-port, this is compatible with
previously created routers as well by continuing to call
_delete_ha_interfaces after the parent router is deleted. This means
that any routers created before this patch will potentially leave
orphans that will have to be manually deleted via the port API.

Closes-Bug: #1540271
Change-Id: Ifd3e007aaf2a2ed8123275aa3a9f540838e3c003
'}]
commit_message:
Add RouterPort binding to ha interface creation

The L3 HA interface cleanup routines during router deletion were
occuring after the parent router resource was deleted. This meant
that if they failed to delete, they would be orphaned since the
parent router was already gone.

This order of router delete and then HA delete was intentional
because deleting them before calling the parent router delete
function would cause them to be deleted before the checks to see
if the router was in use. If the router was in use, the HA interface
would be removed and would leave an HA router in an inconsitent state.
(See I956d0094ae6e2412e859d79feeb4003941d2bb4b for details)

This patch just has the L3 HA code add a RouterPort binding for the
HA interfaces. This allows the parent router_delete call to delete the
HA interfaces automatically after doing the in-use check but before
deleting the actual router.

In order to avoid a migration in a back-port, this is compatible with
previously created routers as well by continuing to call
_delete_ha_interfaces after the parent router is deleted. This means
that any routers created before this patch will potentially leave
orphans that will have to be manually deleted via the port API.

Closes-Bug: #1540271
Change-Id: Ifd3e007aaf2a2ed8123275aa3a9f540838e3c003

subject: Change tunnel MTU calculation to support IPv6
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 12:40:46.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install.rst', 'devstack/lib/networking-ovn'], 'message': "Change tunnel MTU calculation to support IPv6

The tunnel overhead calculation now accounts for the IP overhead.
See [1] for details. As a result, the networking OVN ML2 driver's
geneve max_header_size default configuration is 20 bytes too large
since it included the IPv4 overhead. This patch set takes advantage
of [1] and allows the IP overhead to be calculated by ML2.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320121

Change-Id: Id8ac05c166ebd02e4abf94777020bde34cce808f
Related-Bug: #1584940
"}]
commit_message:
Change tunnel MTU calculation to support IPv6

The tunnel overhead calculation now accounts for the IP overhead.
See [1] for details. As a result, the networking OVN ML2 driver's
geneve max_header_size default configuration is 20 bytes too large
since it included the IPv4 overhead. This patch set takes advantage
of [1] and allows the IP overhead to be calculated by ML2.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320121

Change-Id: Id8ac05c166ebd02e4abf94777020bde34cce808f
Related-Bug: #1584940

commit_message:
Make xenapi driver use flavor fields instead of legacy ones

This makes the xenapi driver use instance.flavor.root_gb instead
of the legacy instance.root_gb field (and friends).

The actual change here is very small, but a lot of xenapi tests
around this needed to be object-ified.

Change-Id: I6a45a22207a44e57506bc2171b10ba1df76277e0

Run ironic coverage jobs in the check pipeline as well

Nobody really pays attentions to post jobs, let's at least make sure
we don't break it. Also I find it pretty useful to see how coverage
is changed in a patch.

Networking-SFC is a neutron big-tent project
Kolla does not have Networking-SFC agent support for now. This
is essential for Service Function Chaining use case. Create
Networking-SFC container and run the agent if enabled.

Implements: blueprint enable-networking-sfc-support
Change-Id: Ib72b7746669eb015fc3ea5838c7f8fec3cc4bf4c
'}]
commit_message:
Support Networking-SFC Container

Networking-SFC is a neutron big-tent project
Kolla does not have Networking-SFC agent support for now. This
is essential for Service Function Chaining use case. Create
Networking-SFC container and run the agent if enabled.

Implements: blueprint enable-networking-sfc-support
Change-Id: Ib72b7746669eb015fc3ea5838c7f8fec3cc4bf4c

commit_message:
Add missing install_tempest_plugins call to upgrade-tempest

Without this call the new installation will not run plugin-specific tests.
The call is placed after configure_tempest just like it's done in tempest
devstack code.

Change-Id: Ia2a5b9cc535c7c46728eee6284a36340745e9043

commit_message:
Add async param to local conductor live_migrate_instance

A new async param was added to the RPC version of live_migrate_instance
in the conductor but it was missed on the local conductor API. This adds
that parameter and adds a unit test that uses the parameter.

Change-Id: I7c44a8fc72ba9afbb67269b0bc7ad59eb9b1580e
Closes-Bug: #1604475

subject: Remove unnecessary overrides of service variables
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 20:02:51.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/heat_service_setup.yml', 'tasks/heat_service_add.yml'], 'message': "Remove unnecessary overrides of service variables

The heat service user, project, region, and password are the same
regardless of the heat service endpoints.

Use the existing heat namespaced variables instead of overriding and
providing a generic 'service_' variable for use with the service setup
tasks.

This also fixes a recursive loop issue seen when deploying the
integrated release with Ansible 2.1.

Change-Id: I350def02e04cd6d8279dcccade607ca3543ef4fa
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary overrides of service variables

The heat service user, project, region, and password are the same
regardless of the heat service endpoints.

Use the existing heat namespaced variables instead of overriding and
providing a generic 'service_' variable for use with the service setup
tasks.

This also fixes a recursive loop issue seen when deploying the
integrated release with Ansible 2.1.

Change-Id: I350def02e04cd6d8279dcccade607ca3543ef4fa

revisions:

The cinder service user, project, region, and password are the same
regardless of the API endpoint version.

Use the existing cinder namespaced variables instead of overriding and
providing a generic 'service_' variable for use with the service setup
tasks.

This also fixes a recursive loop issue seen when deploying the
integrated release with Ansible 2.1: http://tinyurl.com/hhuljtu

Change-Id: I469dcabb03c792abbad7f65a17bfa5f7146dcfa7
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary overrides of service variables

The cinder service user, project, region, and password are the same
regardless of the API endpoint version.

Use the existing cinder namespaced variables instead of overriding and
providing a generic 'service_' variable for use with the service setup
tasks.

This also fixes a recursive loop issue seen when deploying the
integrated release with Ansible 2.1: http://tinyurl.com/hhuljtu

Change-Id: I469dcabb03c792abbad7f65a17bfa5f7146dcfa7

subject: Replace while with if in resolve function
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-20 14:26:49.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/resource_group.py', 'heat/engine/function.py'], 'message': "Replace while with if in resolve function

Functions can't return functions, so we don't need to use `while`.
This doesn't change behaviour of code, just makes it more understandable
and convenient.

Change-Id: Ia1dac5a9583cb99db23a8838412e5bc02e93ef4c
"}]
commit_message:
Replace while with if in resolve function

Functions can't return functions, so we don't need to use `while`.
This doesn't change behaviour of code, just makes it more understandable
and convenient.

Change-Id: Ia1dac5a9583cb99db23a8838412e5bc02e93ef4c

subject: Configure infrastructure MTU with global_physnet_mtu
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 17:22:10.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Configure infrastructure MTU with global_physnet_mtu

The network_device_mtu option will be removed from Neutron in Newton.
The global_physnet_mtu option was introduced in Mitaka. Before Mitaka,
Neutron did not have any multinode jobs that would require setting the
infrastructure MTU for inter-node connectivity.

Change-Id: I337b284076a794027fbd63796119d56bd1923cf2
Related-Bug: #1603493
'}]
commit_message:
Configure infrastructure MTU with global_physnet_mtu

The network_device_mtu option will be removed from Neutron in Newton.
The global_physnet_mtu option was introduced in Mitaka. Before Mitaka,
Neutron did not have any multinode jobs that would require setting the
infrastructure MTU for inter-node connectivity.

Change-Id: I337b284076a794027fbd63796119d56bd1923cf2
Related-Bug: #1603493

commit_message:
Handle Py35 fix of ast.node.col_offset bug

In 3.5, the ast module returns the correct value for the col_offset
of a function definition whereas earlier versions did not. The value
is off by one column.

Closes-Bug: #1603236

Change-Id: I7835d7ed8d652a6bd585e8e0372fab402424038d

commit_message:
Prepare for changes in python-muranoclient action call

Due to changes in commit I672ff44a547b318a3b8cd5b73882a3e1b956d915
call of action will return ActionResult object instead of string with
task_id. This patch allows dashboard to work with both types of returned
values and thus makes change to client possible.
After client changes we can leave just the new variant.

Change-Id: I7e545006f7f6cdd4217e7d8e04e1841d3fee5c07

subject: Make ActionManager and StaticActionManager consistent
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-13 13:01:45.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/action-manager-change-4ce7889d7334f314.yaml', 'muranoclient/v1/actions.py', 'muranoclient/v1/shell.py', 'muranoclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'muranoclient/v1/static_actions.py', 'muranoclient/tests/unit/test_methods.py'], 'message': 'Make ActionManager and StaticActionManager consistent

In the new StaticActionManager, call() method returns special
StaticActionResult object with methods check_result() and
get_result(). This patch makes ActionManager behaviour similar -
its call() method returns ActionResult object with the same
interface. ActionManager and StaticActionManager now are
inheritors of AsyncActionManager class that defines the interface.
To maintain backward compatibility ActionResult also
has get_task_id() method, and ActionResult can also be provided
to get_method() as an argument instead of task_id.

Depends-on: I7e545006f7f6cdd4217e7d8e04e1841d3fee5c07
Change-Id: I672ff44a547b318a3b8cd5b73882a3e1b956d915
'}]
commit_message:
Make ActionManager and StaticActionManager consistent

In the new StaticActionManager, call() method returns special
StaticActionResult object with methods check_result() and
get_result(). This patch makes ActionManager behaviour similar -
its call() method returns ActionResult object with the same
interface. ActionManager and StaticActionManager now are
inheritors of AsyncActionManager class that defines the interface.
To maintain backward compatibility ActionResult also
has get_task_id() method, and ActionResult can also be provided
to get_method() as an argument instead of task_id.

Depends-on: I7e545006f7f6cdd4217e7d8e04e1841d3fee5c07
Change-Id: I672ff44a547b318a3b8cd5b73882a3e1b956d915

commit_message:
Implement rbac list and show command

1. implement "openstack network rbac list"
2. implement "openstack network rbac show"
3. also add FakeRBACPolicy to test "network rbac xxx" command
The unit test class similar to FakeRouter, which is able to
fake one or more rbac policies. It will be used by the rbac
CRUD patches.

Change-Id: I6c97bc8819698546895fd530464a2cbb347bf77d
Co-Authored-By: Huanxuan Ao <huanxuan.ao@easystack.cn>
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-client-rbac
Depends-On: I88f409a24947b67146c0f93ec8480834cef56d2f

subject: Resolves issue where to allow custom repo URLS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 13:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/plugins/ambari/deploy.py'], 'message': 'Resolves issue where to allow custom repo URLS

Using an centos7 image and changing the HDP and HDP-UTILS URL location
resulted in an error of
"os_type=os_type_map[client.get_host_info[ambari.fqdn())["os_type"]]
KeyError: u'centos7'. This results in only being able to change the
HDP and HDP-UTILS URL if you were using centos6 or redhat6.This change
adds centos7 and redhat7 to the map to allow custom HDP and HDP-UTILS URLs.

Should we add additional operating systems to the list?

Closes-Bug: #1599252

Change-Id: Iaa5cd773c5daeabeda287048a2d3f8696faa1436
(cherry picked from commit d067680e68f97b47665bbd9ece2dd810c254385a)
'}]
commit_message:
Resolves issue where to allow custom repo URLS

Using an centos7 image and changing the HDP and HDP-UTILS URL location
resulted in an error of
"os_type=os_type_map[client.get_host_info[ambari.fqdn())["os_type"]]
KeyError: u'centos7'. This results in only being able to change the
HDP and HDP-UTILS URL if you were using centos6 or redhat6.This change
adds centos7 and redhat7 to the map to allow custom HDP and HDP-UTILS URLs.

Should we add additional operating systems to the list?

Closes-Bug: #1599252

Change-Id: Iaa5cd773c5daeabeda287048a2d3f8696faa1436
(cherry picked from commit d067680e68f97b47665bbd9ece2dd810c254385a)

Currently, the tempest security group tests for tempest-dsvm-cells-rc
are blocked because cells doesn't support security groups.  The block is
now done using a nova blacklist:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc

This commit changes tempest-dsvm-cells-rc to remove blacklisted tests.
Inclusion of security group related tests is now controlled
by the tempest config option compute-feature-enabled.security_groups.

Change-Id: Icb6d9934dfbe4a4f03e38a47fb9d29a0e72d1942
Partial-Bug: 1495653
Depends-On: I4f74b80024a9bcc374d374d86052dceb40598d32
"}]
commit_message:
Disable security group tests in tempest-dsvm-cells-rc using a config option

Currently, the tempest security group tests for tempest-dsvm-cells-rc
are blocked because cells doesn't support security groups.  The block is
now done using a nova blacklist:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc

This commit changes tempest-dsvm-cells-rc to remove blacklisted tests.
Inclusion of security group related tests is now controlled
by the tempest config option compute-feature-enabled.security_groups.

Change-Id: Icb6d9934dfbe4a4f03e38a47fb9d29a0e72d1942
Partial-Bug: 1495653
Depends-On: I4f74b80024a9bcc374d374d86052dceb40598d32

commit_message:
Add python-neutronclient to osc-plugin-jobs

Neutron is transitioning its CLI to OSC. Some CLIs will reside
within python-openstackclient while others will be OSC plugins
within python-neutronclient (see [1]). In order to support this,
add osc-plugin-jobs support for python-neutronclient per [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/309587/
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/plugins.html

Change-Id: I86595e02ec23f2ab68964ba2bdab51ccb3ffef8a
Related-Bug: #1521291

subject: Update dist-sort module for better effectiveness
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-20 13:43:07.000000000', 'files': ['library/dist_sort'], 'message': 'Update dist-sort module for better effectiveness

The dist-sort module has been updated to ensure its execution
is effective, fast, and nonintrusive. There are cases where
the rounds made by the module take an excessive amount of time
to complete. This change ensures that the module is limiting its
rounds to a known index and the iterable is processed using a
generator.

Change-Id: I03d1f70cb6cd17f38ef37b4d8371a8982beca29e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update dist-sort module for better effectiveness

The dist-sort module has been updated to ensure its execution
is effective, fast, and nonintrusive. There are cases where
the rounds made by the module take an excessive amount of time
to complete. This change ensures that the module is limiting its
rounds to a known index and the iterable is processed using a
generator.

Change-Id: I03d1f70cb6cd17f38ef37b4d8371a8982beca29e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:

This patch adds 'functional' test that will be run by dsvm gate.
A 'cloudsConfig.js' file converts OpenStack environment variables
into a configuration object similar to 'clouds.yaml' structure, so
tests can communicate with devstack.
Karma activates a babel plugin in order to convert those environment
variables into inline values.

A dummy test has been added to demonstrate use of devstack config.

This review was inspired from 'python-openstacksdk' work:
https://github.com/openstack/python-openstacksdk

Change-Id: I6a685337ce5e057c5df112a83895b4c9c4691f6f
"}]
commit_message:
Add functional tests for devstack gate

This patch adds 'functional' test that will be run by dsvm gate.
A 'cloudsConfig.js' file converts OpenStack environment variables
into a configuration object similar to 'clouds.yaml' structure, so
tests can communicate with devstack.
Karma activates a babel plugin in order to convert those environment
variables into inline values.

A dummy test has been added to demonstrate use of devstack config.

This review was inspired from 'python-openstacksdk' work:
https://github.com/openstack/python-openstacksdk

Change-Id: I6a685337ce5e057c5df112a83895b4c9c4691f6f

Unit tests fail because of two reasons:
1) Latest manilaclient requires more stricter mocking in unit tests.
So, mock it properly.
2) Horizon's test settings file has not been used. So, start using
original Horizon's settings file instead of our own obsolete version.

Change-Id: If83e66d4b2f0f1db181e7c23ac256c498566c2da
Closes-Bug: #1604348

commit_message:
Fix unit tests

Unit tests fail because of two reasons:
1) Latest manilaclient requires more stricter mocking in unit tests.
So, mock it properly.
2) Horizon's test settings file has not been used. So, start using
original Horizon's settings file instead of our own obsolete version.

Change-Id: If83e66d4b2f0f1db181e7c23ac256c498566c2da
Closes-Bug: #1604348

commit_message:
Use own rpm_split_filename function to reduce dependencies

rpmUtils is from yum but we just need a single function to
split a rpm filename into it's components.
So copy the function from rpmUtils and use the copy.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-20 00:20:39.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/libvirt.py'], 'message': 'Add region_name into neutron-client for libvirt

Passing in the region_name argument for creating neutron client
is required same as nova client. Parameter region_name is required
for libvirt detection plugin so that neutron knows which endpoint
from the service catalog to choose.

This only occurs on multi region deployments.

Change-Id: I9509292bfaf319e80f5cfe08a4321ca635ce3403
'}]
commit_message:
Add region_name into neutron-client for libvirt

Passing in the region_name argument for creating neutron client
is required same as nova client. Parameter region_name is required
for libvirt detection plugin so that neutron knows which endpoint
from the service catalog to choose.

This only occurs on multi region deployments.

Change-Id: I9509292bfaf319e80f5cfe08a4321ca635ce3403

subject: Change names of token drivers in init.pp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 21:26:32.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp'], 'message': 'Change names of token drivers in init.pp

Documentation for Keystone initialization refers to UPPER or
CamelCase names. Keystone drivers use all lowercase, and using
an incorrectly cased name will throw a Stevedore load error.

Change-Id: I50aa7da46018799224031226d23fa45820b51a20
'}]
owner_name: Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)
commit_message:
Change names of token drivers in init.pp

Documentation for Keystone initialization refers to UPPER or
CamelCase names. Keystone drivers use all lowercase, and using
an incorrectly cased name will throw a Stevedore load error.

Change-Id: I50aa7da46018799224031226d23fa45820b51a20

commit_message:
ExecutionDriver handles exec requests from replicated PEs

agnostic.py:Dse2Runtime now requests exec through request_execute,
ExecutionDriver locally selects and obeys leader PE-node.
Leadership is vacated when heartbeat is lost.

tests/helper.py:TestFailureException defined to allow using
assertRaises to check for test failure when retry tests fails
(generic Exception disallowed by pep8 check/gate)

Closes-Bug: 1600012
Partially implements blueprint: high-availability-design

Change-Id: I32b6d8a8d78bfac74b85d2b415035083b2917fb8

commit_message:
Added *.tgz to .gitignore files

`npm pack` creates a tarball, which is not ignored by gitignore and
thus causes the assert-no-extra-files job to error (silently). This
adds these files to the .gitignore.

Change-Id: Ia1360973acabdec347e9ca449eb9c17d8e416860

commit_message:
Fix cfapi test job

After change I17ab2eba0fd6c42309667f42d0644d21940ab02d was merged cfapi
job starts failing. This cause of it is the change in mock_muranopl.yaml
file which is used in tempest tests. Now we remove this change and
update mechanism which added class name by overwrite mock_muranopl.yaml.

commit_message:
Remove deprecated code

Dropped:
* classes -  "keystone::python"
* parameters - in "keystone" class:
  * admin_workers
  * public_workers

Behavior changes:
* "keystone" class:
  * "cache_memcache_servers" parameter:
    * don't inherit "memcache_servers"
    * "memcache_servers" & "cache_memcache_servers"
      defaults coincide
    * but it is expected to use both params
    service)

Notes:
* "cache_enabled" ("keystone" class):
  * remove legacy automatic enabling
  * enabled by default (os_service_default)

Co-Authored-By: Iury Gregory <iurygregory@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I1316dd95074f1d296210dd87504938d83ee476d6

commit_message:
Fix keystone_authtoken middleware for nova

This change removes the signing_dir from the nova configuration as it is
for PKI tokens which are no longer supported. Additionally, the
keystone_authtoken/memcached_servers should be configured only for the
api services.

Change-Id: I35b91b4fe65d79a5cd4ed81a584d67a97a1e21d5
Related-Bug: #1600276

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-18 20:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/update.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': 'Allow a grace period when cancelling a stack update

Use a progress callback for cancelling updates so that we will apply the
usual grace period to allow resources to complete when cancelling a stack
update, instead of cancelling immediately. Previously, resources could

Related-Bug: #1591337

commit_message:
Allow a grace period when cancelling a stack update

Use a progress callback for cancelling updates so that we will apply the
usual grace period to allow resources to complete when cancelling a stack
update, instead of cancelling immediately. Previously, resources could
unneccessarily be marked as FAILED, resulting in them unneccessarily being
replaced on a subsequent update.

Change-Id: I0a5bf998be764e4d6d4c6ea86aaca7f715b93d06
Related-Bug: #1591337

subject: Use a queue instead of an event to send messages
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-18 20:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_update.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_update.py', 'heat/tests/engine/service/test_threadgroup_mgr.py', 'heat/tests/engine/tools.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Use a queue instead of an event to send messages

This has a couple of effects. One is that we can send more than one message
to an action (since the action need not terminate immediately upon
receiving a message). The other is that we only ever receive the message
once, instead of every time we check for it once it has been sent.

Change-Id: Ib3b33534c0e8b03dfbbb1acde6f7b2d3dcfa82b6
'}]
commit_message:
Use a queue instead of an event to send messages

This has a couple of effects. One is that we can send more than one message
to an action (since the action need not terminate immediately upon
receiving a message). The other is that we only ever receive the message
once, instead of every time we check for it once it has been sent.

Change-Id: Ib3b33534c0e8b03dfbbb1acde6f7b2d3dcfa82b6

subject: Raise the last exception thrown into DependencyTaskGroup
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-18 20:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/test_scheduler.py', 'heat/engine/scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Raise the last exception thrown into DependencyTaskGroup

Normally when exceptions are caught in DependencyTaskGroup, we cancel with
a grace period and then re-raise the first exception once all subtasks are
stopped. This means that e.g. when a resource fails, the exception the
stack gets back is from the first resource failure and not e.g. any
resulting exceptions from cancelled in-progress resources.

However, for exceptions thrown in to the task from the outside (as opposed
to raised by one of the subtasks), we generally want the *last* one to be
re-raised. Specifically, if a cancel-without-rollback exception is thrown
followed by a cancel-with-rollback, we want the with-rollback exception to
be re-raised so that the stack knows to roll back.

Change-Id: I4843f9a55a4897a7af86a9aa69df073913fd03e6
'}]
commit_message:
Raise the last exception thrown into DependencyTaskGroup

Normally when exceptions are caught in DependencyTaskGroup, we cancel with
a grace period and then re-raise the first exception once all subtasks are
stopped. This means that e.g. when a resource fails, the exception the
stack gets back is from the first resource failure and not e.g. any
resulting exceptions from cancelled in-progress resources.

However, for exceptions thrown in to the task from the outside (as opposed
to raised by one of the subtasks), we generally want the *last* one to be
re-raised. Specifically, if a cancel-without-rollback exception is thrown
followed by a cancel-with-rollback, we want the with-rollback exception to
be re-raised so that the stack knows to roll back.

Change-Id: I4843f9a55a4897a7af86a9aa69df073913fd03e6

subject: Scheduler: Add a progress callback to TaskRunner
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-18 20:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/test_scheduler.py', 'heat/engine/scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Scheduler: Add a progress callback to TaskRunner

This allows the caller to specify an arbitrary function to be called after
each sleep() when running a task. Callers can use this to keep track of
progress or keep track of external state. Any exception raised by the
callback function will be thrown into the task.

Change-Id: I637166f9448169eed8696e5b0fba106b8de1547a
'}]
commit_message:
Scheduler: Add a progress callback to TaskRunner

This allows the caller to specify an arbitrary function to be called after
each sleep() when running a task. Callers can use this to keep track of
progress or keep track of external state. Any exception raised by the
callback function will be thrown into the task.

Change-Id: I637166f9448169eed8696e5b0fba106b8de1547a

subject: Always call TaskRunner._sleep()
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-18 20:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack_update.py', 'heat/engine/scheduler.py'], 'message': "Always call TaskRunner._sleep()

In the patch 5f584db8d55a6db76c4307b21cb658a2bacb0296, we avoid calling
TaskRunner._sleep() after the first step if the wait_time is 0 or None.
This is wrong in the case of a wait_time of 0 - since this is distinct from
None, and should result in us calling eventlet.sleep(0). It's also
inconsistent in the case of wait_time=None, since for the rest of the steps
we call self._sleep(None) (and no actual sleep occurs).

This patch ensures we always call self._sleep(), passing 0 or None as
appropriate.

It also enhances the change in d66d57f187c7d8623526e9f928ae76d2cca9ecf9 to
ensure that we never yield from DependencyTaskGroup after all tasks are
completed, which could happen if that last batch of tasks to be started all
completed in a single step. This both saves changing the unit test to
accomodate the new _sleep(None) call and avoids an unnecessary
eventlet.sleep(0) call in real usage.

Change-Id: I301930fcba170e36d2d902c8d693ca722476cd18
"}]
commit_message:
Always call TaskRunner._sleep()

In the patch 5f584db8d55a6db76c4307b21cb658a2bacb0296, we avoid calling
TaskRunner._sleep() after the first step if the wait_time is 0 or None.
This is wrong in the case of a wait_time of 0 - since this is distinct from
None, and should result in us calling eventlet.sleep(0). It's also
inconsistent in the case of wait_time=None, since for the rest of the steps
we call self._sleep(None) (and no actual sleep occurs).

This patch ensures we always call self._sleep(), passing 0 or None as
appropriate.

It also enhances the change in d66d57f187c7d8623526e9f928ae76d2cca9ecf9 to
ensure that we never yield from DependencyTaskGroup after all tasks are
completed, which could happen if that last batch of tasks to be started all
completed in a single step. This both saves changing the unit test to
accomodate the new _sleep(None) call and avoids an unnecessary
eventlet.sleep(0) call in real usage.

Change-Id: I301930fcba170e36d2d902c8d693ca722476cd18

subject: Unit tests: add a test resource that takes multiple steps
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-18 20:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/common.py', 'heat/tests/generic_resource.py'], 'message': 'Unit tests: add a test resource that takes multiple steps

All of the current test resource types complete in a single step (i.e. have
no check_*_complete() methods). In order to test longer-running resources,
add a resource type in which the number of steps can be specified as a
property.

Change-Id: Ia894efa3207130a187032f2f667c096dee883aea
'}]
commit_message:
Unit tests: add a test resource that takes multiple steps

All of the current test resource types complete in a single step (i.e. have
no check_*_complete() methods). In order to test longer-running resources,
add a resource type in which the number of steps can be specified as a
property.

Change-Id: Ia894efa3207130a187032f2f667c096dee883aea

commit_message:
Avoiding created multiple gateway ports on *one* router gateway

This patch set use feature "trigger" in database. This is useful
in case there are multi concurent request to add gateway ports to
*one* router. Only one request suggest, other request will be
refused.

Change-Id: I59a992842e9cb0e848f5e78d01d19f9beb5a5148
Closes-Bug: #1535225

commit_message:
Enable use of use_neutron flag

For mitaka onwards, use of the 'use_neutron' flag should be made
instead of setting the network API class.

For newton, this is required as the network_api_class is ignored.

commit_message:
[k8s] Save gateway node ip before its release for proper reporting

During scaling gateways down, reporter was trying to get ip of the
instance which was already released and that caused index error.
This patch saves this ip for report before releasing resourses.

Change-Id: I9310a423b1ad8c488c1cc7400844ae5d8767879c
Closes-bug: #1590728

This will be useful in numerous places where we use a TaskRunner to provide
a timeout when we are already inside a wrappertask. It eliminates the
need to manually advance the TaskRunner, and ensures correct exception

commit_message:
Scheduler: Allow TaskRunner to be used as a task

This will be useful in numerous places where we use a TaskRunner to provide
a timeout when we are already inside a wrappertask. It eliminates the
need to manually advance the TaskRunner, and ensures correct exception
handling.

Change-Id: I9be0a361e1d1856adb6eee2ef0da8d5aa23795be

commit_message:
Run AuthTokenTests against fernet and uuid

Previously, AuthTokenTests inherited the test structure and ran the tests with
the default keystone configuration. This commit breaks AuthTokenTests to
inherit from `object` and sets up FernetAuthTokenTests and UUIDAuthTokenTests
to setup configuration appropriately and run the tests.

This fix was originally a part of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258650 but
this is an attempt to break 258650 into smaller, more reviewable, pieces.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayound@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I9acacfe7db4997add5505a9ee1972139af11979e
Partial-Bug: 1561054

subject: Catch barbicanclient not existing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 14:56:00.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/signature_utils.py'], 'message': 'Catch barbicanclient not existing

Causes signature error would then be caught in glance/api/v2/image_data.py
causing the image to be deleted rather than being left in the queued
state.

This stops the 500 being raised and the image left in the queued state.

Change-Id: I885c898c1487c450abdfa7d6a79f526a132fbbcb
Closes-Bug: 1602715
'}]
commit_message:
Catch barbicanclient not existing

Causes signature error would then be caught in glance/api/v2/image_data.py
causing the image to be deleted rather than being left in the queued
state.

This stops the 500 being raised and the image left in the queued state.

Change-Id: I885c898c1487c450abdfa7d6a79f526a132fbbcb
Closes-Bug: 1602715

commit_message:
Add support for custom Horizon themes

Deployers can now configure their own custom
themes and set them as the default theme using the
Horizon configuration values AVAILABLE_THEMES and
DEFAULT_THEME

See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/settings.html#available-themes
for further details on the configuration.

Change-Id: I90b1cb45c851eb654638d82b83af56f93a642895

(cherry picked from commit 49376929fbce50d730a3379b7e250c8a9f77fe70)

commit_message:
Added Karma integration

This commit introduces Karma test runner which allows running
Jasmine-based tests in browsers.

We pass the response dictionary instead of a message as the third
argument to assertEqual in some unit tests in test_volume_manage.
This patch fixes that usage. It also fixes the order of arguments
in assertEqual.

Change-Id: Ie2a0cc62d551251a1756b3bad459fc9f15b7596c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix assertEqual usage in test_volume_manage

We pass the response dictionary instead of a message as the third
argument to assertEqual in some unit tests in test_volume_manage.
This patch fixes that usage. It also fixes the order of arguments
in assertEqual.

Change-Id: Ie2a0cc62d551251a1756b3bad459fc9f15b7596c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8932, 'name': 'Telles Mota Vidal Nóbrega', 'email': 'tellesnobrega@gmail.com', 'username': 'tellesnobrega'}, {'_account_id': 12038, 'name': 'Vitaly Gridnev', 'email': 'gridnevvvit@gmail.com', 'username': 'vgridnev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-09 20:02:56.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/plugins/ambari/deploy.py'], 'message': 'Resolves issue where to allow custom repo URLS

Using an centos7 image and changing the HDP and HDP-UTILS URL location
resulted in an error of
"os_type=os_type_map[client.get_host_info[ambari.fqdn())["os_type"]]
KeyError: u'centos7'. This results in only being able to change the
HDP and HDP-UTILS URL if you were using centos6 or redhat6.This change
adds centos7 and redhat7 to the map to allow custom HDP and HDP-UTILS URLs.

Should we add additional operating systems to the list?

Closes-Bug: #1599252

Change-Id: Iaa5cd773c5daeabeda287048a2d3f8696faa1436
'}]
commit_message:
Resolves issue where to allow custom repo URLS

Using an centos7 image and changing the HDP and HDP-UTILS URL location
resulted in an error of
"os_type=os_type_map[client.get_host_info[ambari.fqdn())["os_type"]]
KeyError: u'centos7'. This results in only being able to change the
HDP and HDP-UTILS URL if you were using centos6 or redhat6.This change
adds centos7 and redhat7 to the map to allow custom HDP and HDP-UTILS URLs.

Should we add additional operating systems to the list?

Closes-Bug: #1599252

Change-Id: Iaa5cd773c5daeabeda287048a2d3f8696faa1436

commit_message:
py3: Replace map/filter with a list comprehension

The map and filter functions returns a list in python 2 but
an iterator in python 3. However, there are instances where
the code assumes the returned value from map/value to be a
list. Substitute these functions to its list comprehension
equivalent expression to enable compatibility with Python 3.

Change-Id: Iccaa3d1f4b009f59ea575c955ee4015e964f2318

commit_message:
Enable use of use_neutron flag

For mitaka onwards, use of the 'use_neutron' flag should be made
instead of setting the network API class.

For newton, this is required as the network_api_class is ignored.

Change-Id: Ifb359d0a3d2a84f0f3bc4cbb944efdde7866950a
