For newton, this is required as the network_api_class is ignored.

Change-Id: I843d82eb0518a0c27858816becf0f8b392bdb5eb
"}]
commit_message:
Enable use of use_neutron flag

For mitaka onwards, use of the 'use_neutron' flag should be made
instead of setting the network API class.

For newton, this is required as the network_api_class is ignored.

Change-Id: I843d82eb0518a0c27858816becf0f8b392bdb5eb

subject: Fix improperly placed firewall.update_filters when aborting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 03:07:55.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/introspect.py'], 'message': 'Fix improperly placed firewall.update_filters when aborting

Currently, firewall.update_filters() is called before introspection
finished, which has no effect as it white-lists MAC addresses that
are under introspection.

Change-Id: I789e39a86dc72470b80167e53f1755b506ca6f44
Closes-Bug: #1548806
'}]
commit_message:
Fix improperly placed firewall.update_filters when aborting

Currently, firewall.update_filters() is called before introspection
finished, which has no effect as it white-lists MAC addresses that
are under introspection.

Change-Id: I789e39a86dc72470b80167e53f1755b506ca6f44
Closes-Bug: #1548806

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-07-18 19:45:38.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/ceilometer/collector.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/neutron.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/ironic.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/neutron/server.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/glance/registry.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/neutron/plugins/plumgrid.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/trove/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/cinder/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/heat/engine.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/gnocchi/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/heat/engine.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/gnocchi/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/neutron/plugins/ml2.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/manila/scheduler.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/nova/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/neutron/plugins/opencontrail.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/neutron/plugins/opencontrail.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/keystone.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/nova/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/sahara/engine.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/neutron/plugins/nuage.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/neutron/plugins/ml2.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/keystone.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/neutron/plugins/plumgrid.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/sahara/engine.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/cinder/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/glance.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/neutron/plugins/nuage.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/ceilometer/collector.pp'], 'message': "Make ::tripleo::profile::base classes work with multiple nodes

In the Next Generation HA architecture a number of active/active services
will be run via systemd. In order for this to work we need to make sure that
the sync_db operation only takes place on the bootstrap node, just like it is
done today for the pacemaker profiles.

We do this by removing sync_db as a parameter and instead set it to true
or false depending if the hostname matches the bootstrap_node as it is done
today in the pacemaker role.

Note that we call hiera('bootstrap_nodeid', undef) because if a profile
is included on a non controller node that variable will be undefined.

The following testing was done:
- HA puppet-pacemaker.yaml scenario with three computes
- NonHA with one controller
- NonHA with three controllers

Fixes-Bug: 1600149

Co-Author: cmsj@tenshu.net

Change-Id: I04a7b9e3c18627ea512000a34357acb7f27d6e0e
Implements: blueprint ha-lightweight-architecture
"}]
commit_message:
Make ::tripleo::profile::base classes work with multiple nodes

In the Next Generation HA architecture a number of active/active services
will be run via systemd. In order for this to work we need to make sure that
the sync_db operation only takes place on the bootstrap node, just like it is
done today for the pacemaker profiles.

We do this by removing sync_db as a parameter and instead set it to true
or false depending if the hostname matches the bootstrap_node as it is done
today in the pacemaker role.

Note that we call hiera('bootstrap_nodeid', undef) because if a profile
is included on a non controller node that variable will be undefined.

The following testing was done:
- HA puppet-pacemaker.yaml scenario with three computes
- NonHA with one controller
- NonHA with three controllers

Fixes-Bug: 1600149

Co-Author: cmsj@tenshu.net

Change-Id: I04a7b9e3c18627ea512000a34357acb7f27d6e0e
Implements: blueprint ha-lightweight-architecture

subject: Allow individual resources to control the cancellation grace period
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-18 20:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/update.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Allow individual resources to control the cancellation grace period

Instead of having a single (configurable) error_wait_time to wait after
errors before cancelling other resources in the same stack, allow each
resource to specify the grace period.

By default, IN_PROGRESS resources return error_wait_time as before, unless
they have implemented a handle_<action>_cancel() for the current action. In
this case there is no grace period; the task will be cancelled and
handle_<action>_cancel() called immediately.

Change-Id: I94255fdeadfaa398cdd34a6f83ce5ed1a7890540
'}]
commit_message:
Allow individual resources to control the cancellation grace period

Instead of having a single (configurable) error_wait_time to wait after
errors before cancelling other resources in the same stack, allow each
resource to specify the grace period.

By default, IN_PROGRESS resources return error_wait_time as before, unless
they have implemented a handle_<action>_cancel() for the current action. In
this case there is no grace period; the task will be cancelled and
handle_<action>_cancel() called immediately.

Change-Id: I94255fdeadfaa398cdd34a6f83ce5ed1a7890540

commit_message:
Define keystone region name.

If multiple regions exist, keystone_authtoken should contain
region_name.  This prevents the nova service from authenticating
across regions.

commit_message:
make sure we start nova-compute after nova-conductor

When nova-compute and nova-conductor are collocated, we need to make
sure nova-conductor starts before nova-compute otherwise nova-compute
will just fail to start.

Change-Id: Icc3ed768af2a08e2db78d9c9278d309a62d26850

This patch makes the --help output a bit more friendly for new users
and allows a user to provide a GitHub API token via an environment
variable to avoid GitHub's low API limits for unauthenticated users.

Logging is also available and users can enable debug logging to
get some reassurance that things are happening when the script
makes lots of requests to GitHub.

I'll follow this up with some documentation soon.

Change-Id: I17734f16dcecd2d62a202b99346d635fd0980856
"}]
commit_message:
Make osa-differ more friendly

This patch makes the --help output a bit more friendly for new users
and allows a user to provide a GitHub API token via an environment
variable to avoid GitHub's low API limits for unauthenticated users.

Logging is also available and users can enable debug logging to
get some reassurance that things are happening when the script
makes lots of requests to GitHub.

I'll follow this up with some documentation soon.

Change-Id: I17734f16dcecd2d62a202b99346d635fd0980856

commit_message:
Use http_proxy_to_wsgi instead of ssl middleware

The ssl middleware from oslo.middleware is deprecated in favor of
http_proxy_to_wsgi, which is used by nova, cinder, glance and several
other services.

Change-Id: Id33a0f7eeb8ced77d09f9edd6b1d65697d8bcfe7

subject: Fixing three mistakes, plus missing durability steps.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-19 15:03:25.000000000', 'files': ['firstapp/samples/fog/block_storage.rb', 'firstapp/samples/fog/getting_started.rb', 'firstapp/samples/fog/durability.rb', 'firstapp/samples/fog/scaling_out.rb', 'firstapp/samples/fog/introduction.rb'], 'message': "Fixing three mistakes, plus missing durability steps.

1) 'Fog#wait_for' hangs forever.

Using #wait_for directly on the instance model
is the right way to go.

2) Fixed incorrect variable name.

This was causing the IP assignment to fail.

3) Typo in durability

direcories.

4) Added steps for durability

Steps 10, 11, and 13.

Change-Id: Iffac65777e06fc36c5c815a7eef6c4e8523000a1
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing three mistakes, plus missing durability steps.

1) 'Fog#wait_for' hangs forever.

Using #wait_for directly on the instance model
is the right way to go.

2) Fixed incorrect variable name.

This was causing the IP assignment to fail.

3) Typo in durability

direcories.

4) Added steps for durability

Steps 10, 11, and 13.

Change-Id: Iffac65777e06fc36c5c815a7eef6c4e8523000a1

subject: Make some tests into real fixtures
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-06-27 08:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['functional/tests/identity/v2/common.py', 'functional/tests/volume/v1/common.py', 'functional/tests/identity/v3/common.py', 'functional/tests/image/v1/test_image.py', 'functional/tests/volume/v2/common.py', 'functional/tests/image/v2/test_image.py'], 'message': 'Make some tests into real fixtures

Some tests modify os.environ, which may adversely affect subsequent
tests, so make them into real fixtures that cleanup after they are
run, by reverting the environment to the state it was before.

This uncovered missing super() calls & a test that was relying on
the previously set environment variable, they should be more robust
now.

Closes-Bug: 1479954

Change-Id: Icc7756b92c02af9ad158436290f4c36c3e986760
Signed-off-by: Vincent Legoll <vincent.legoll@idgrilles.fr>
'}]
commit_message:
Make some tests into real fixtures

Some tests modify os.environ, which may adversely affect subsequent
tests, so make them into real fixtures that cleanup after they are
run, by reverting the environment to the state it was before.

This uncovered missing super() calls & a test that was relying on
the previously set environment variable, they should be more robust
now.

Closes-Bug: 1479954

Change-Id: Icc7756b92c02af9ad158436290f4c36c3e986760
Signed-off-by: Vincent Legoll <vincent.legoll@idgrilles.fr>

commit_message:
Add and document the "rotational" root device hint

This patch is adding a new root device hint called "rotational". This
hint is used to identify whether a device is rotational or not making it
easy to distinguish HDDs and SSDs when choosing which disk Ironic
should deploy the image onto.

Closes-Bug: #1599517
Depends-On: I270fe57df825929bdef7911b3a6757cf7163a5f1
Change-Id: Id630a0b9d02ed8e1bd674c32bef0d489849c3f29

Fix update_network_cidr method

subnet() method of netaddr.IPNetwork expects size of subnets to be returned
so we should pass to it subnet of the smaller size, not 1

Closes-Bug: #1571543

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14689, 'name': 'Vitaly Sedelnik', 'email': 'vitaly.sedelnik@canonical.com', 'username': 'vsedelnik'}, {'_account_id': 18205, 'name': 'Bulat Gaifullin', 'email': 'gaifullinbf@gmail.com', 'username': 'bgaifullin'}, {'_account_id': 18845, 'name': 'Sergii Rizvan', 'email': 'srizvan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'srizvan'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-10 11:02:24.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_nailgun.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/drivers/nailgun.py'], 'message': "Use any disk for /boot regardless of its size

Apparently, the disks which're bigger than 2T were excluded from list
of bootable disks if possible. Just because in the past, those disks
were unrecognized by BIOS (or UEFI under CSM).

In fact, it was just misconfiguration of RAID controller or BIOS
itself.

GRUB uses BIOS INT13h in order to find all available disks.
Therefore, unless particular disk is not configured as 'bootable',
there's no change for GRUB to find it.

One should configure hardware in the following way assuming that
the first disk (hd0) is bootable and is used for operating system
purposes.
In case of hardware RAID, FC multipath or any other HBA, the disk
(or lun, or whatever) which was configured as 'bootable' will be
reported as hd0 via INT13h. So, GRUB will be able to boot from it.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1588260

Change-Id: I7bc729ffafa3b9d6bfe8521fa38599d36d02f7e1
(backported from commit 5cc463edfbc04e763cb77c01c3e5a3b430b778be)
"}]
commit_message:
Use any disk for /boot regardless of its size

Apparently, the disks which're bigger than 2T were excluded from list
of bootable disks if possible. Just because in the past, those disks
were unrecognized by BIOS (or UEFI under CSM).

In fact, it was just misconfiguration of RAID controller or BIOS
itself.

GRUB uses BIOS INT13h in order to find all available disks.
Therefore, unless particular disk is not configured as 'bootable',
there's no change for GRUB to find it.

One should configure hardware in the following way assuming that
the first disk (hd0) is bootable and is used for operating system
purposes.
In case of hardware RAID, FC multipath or any other HBA, the disk
(or lun, or whatever) which was configured as 'bootable' will be
reported as hd0 via INT13h. So, GRUB will be able to boot from it.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1588260

Change-Id: I7bc729ffafa3b9d6bfe8521fa38599d36d02f7e1
(backported from commit 5cc463edfbc04e763cb77c01c3e5a3b430b778be)

subject: Clarify unittest documentation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-15 20:37:38.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/trove_testtools.py', 'doc/source/dev/testing.rst'], 'message': "Clarify unittest documentation

 - Update the description.
   Dangling mocks are no longer detected after
   every single test case.
 - Use a preffered pattern for unmocking.
 - Allow the 'patch_conf_property' take an optional
   'section' argument and add examples on configuration
    mocking to the doc.
 - Add extra examples on object mocking.

Change-Id: I9dc6d26ca879b0d5e1b16d1bdbc97b2a81351781
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify unittest documentation

 - Update the description.
   Dangling mocks are no longer detected after
   every single test case.
 - Use a preffered pattern for unmocking.
 - Allow the 'patch_conf_property' take an optional
   'section' argument and add examples on configuration
    mocking to the doc.
 - Add extra examples on object mocking.

Change-Id: I9dc6d26ca879b0d5e1b16d1bdbc97b2a81351781

commit_message:
Use bundletester for amulet test execution

Switch to using bundletester for execution of functional tests,
leveraging tox to build out test virtualenvs.

Rename amulet tests inline with gate-*, dev-* and dfs-*
naming standards.

Update README to refer to functional testing section of the charm
guide.

Also remove brittle auth conf checks which are failing at
cinder-ceph master. Even without those explicit checks, if auth
fails, functional tests will still fail and block.

Change-Id: I91e638f98f70c7098f089c7e60c1181632b39222

subject: Remove redundant code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 08:40:09.000000000', 'files': ['swift/proxy/controllers/account.py'], 'message': 'Remove redundant code

When account is created, the length of its name is strictly limited
(len(self.account_name) <= constraints.MAX_ACCOUNT_NAME_LENGTH).
So When len(self.account_name) > constraints.MAX_ACCOUNT_NAME_LENGTH,
this account certainly does not exist. It's unnecessary to check the
length of account_name when the request "get or head" method arrives.
Just need to check normally if this account exists.

Change-Id: Iaded650a136db1ef34b9cd3a07685716b0e4b72a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant code

When account is created, the length of its name is strictly limited
(len(self.account_name) <= constraints.MAX_ACCOUNT_NAME_LENGTH).
So When len(self.account_name) > constraints.MAX_ACCOUNT_NAME_LENGTH,
this account certainly does not exist. It's unnecessary to check the
length of account_name when the request "get or head" method arrives.
Just need to check normally if this account exists.

Change-Id: Iaded650a136db1ef34b9cd3a07685716b0e4b72a

subject: Fix user/database scenarios to run without helper
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-30 18:13:33.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/scenario/runners/user_actions_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/database_actions_runners.py'], 'message': "Fix user/database scenarios to run without helper

Datastores that do not define their own thest helper run with
the default implementation from 'test_helper.py'.

The test code does not handle None values returned from
the base helper methods causing NoneType access failures.

This patch set avoids these hard failures by skipping
the tests that could not run.

Change-Id: Ifc0b0375e3191ca1e157d90c519c768d37851047
"}]
commit_message:
Fix user/database scenarios to run without helper

Datastores that do not define their own thest helper run with
the default implementation from 'test_helper.py'.

The test code does not handle None values returned from
the base helper methods causing NoneType access failures.

This patch set avoids these hard failures by skipping
the tests that could not run.

Change-Id: Ifc0b0375e3191ca1e157d90c519c768d37851047

subject: Correction in kube-ui-service.sh script
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 668, 'name': 'Adrian Otto', 'email': 'aotto@aotto.com', 'username': 'aotto'}, {'_account_id': 10206, 'name': 'Madhuri Kumari', 'email': 'madhuri.kumari@intel.com', 'username': 'Madhuri'}, {'_account_id': 10263, 'name': 'Vilobh Meshram', 'email': 'vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com', 'username': 'vilobhmm'}, {'_account_id': 12175, 'name': 'Eli Qiao', 'email': 'qiaoliyong@gmail.com', 'username': 'Eli'}, {'_account_id': 15123, 'name': 'Drago', 'email': 'drago.rosson@rackspace.com', 'username': 'Drago'}, {'_account_id': 20498, 'name': 'Spyros Trigazis', 'email': 'spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch', 'username': 'strigazi'}, {'_account_id': 22493, 'name': 'Michael Liu', 'email': 'ztehypervisor@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'Michaelliu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-13 03:17:50.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/kube-ui-service.sh'], 'message': 'Correction in kube-ui-service.sh script

Currently kube-ui-service.sh service has set "Requires" option
which specify list of units to be activated together with the
unit. If any of the unit described with "Requires" fails then
unit is also failed.

According to bug if kube-ui-service fails first time, "Requires"
option make sure that kube-system-namespace has to be started
before kube-ui-service therefor kube-system-namespace gets
started. When next time, we try to start kube-ui-service then
it again try to start kube-system-namespace first but it fails,
therefor kube-ui-service also fails.

To reduce this strong dependencies, "Wants" has been used to
introduce weaker dependencies. So if second time kube-ui-service
has been started then it tries to start kube-system-namespace
but it fails but due to weaker dependencies kube-ui-service does
not fail.

Question still remains, whether it is allowed to start
kube-ui-service if kube-system-namespace fails first time.

Change-Id: I5ee51ec1ba9be031285f4a391cc67ee43c97f5da
Closes-Bug: #1576622
'}]
commit_message:
Correction in kube-ui-service.sh script

Currently kube-ui-service.sh service has set "Requires" option
which specify list of units to be activated together with the
unit. If any of the unit described with "Requires" fails then
unit is also failed.

According to bug if kube-ui-service fails first time, "Requires"
option make sure that kube-system-namespace has to be started
before kube-ui-service therefor kube-system-namespace gets
started. When next time, we try to start kube-ui-service then
it again try to start kube-system-namespace first but it fails,
therefor kube-ui-service also fails.

To reduce this strong dependencies, "Wants" has been used to
introduce weaker dependencies. So if second time kube-ui-service
has been started then it tries to start kube-system-namespace
but it fails but due to weaker dependencies kube-ui-service does
not fail.

Question still remains, whether it is allowed to start
kube-ui-service if kube-system-namespace fails first time.

Change-Id: I5ee51ec1ba9be031285f4a391cc67ee43c97f5da
Closes-Bug: #1576622

This patch adds a new tool under devstack that creates chassis, nodes
and ports from a yaml file. The syntax of the file is checked by a
schema.

Example usagge:

1- Download a sample inventory from: http://paste.openstack.org/show/506999/
2- Execute the tool passing this inventory as parameter:

  $ devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/import_inventory.py inventory.yaml

For additional parameters use --help

Change-Id: Ia714445ab1ffb3e4b44580a0a262cd4d96944ce2
'}]
commit_message:
Import inventory from file (PoC)

This patch adds a new tool under devstack that creates chassis, nodes
and ports from a yaml file. The syntax of the file is checked by a
schema.

Example usagge:

1- Download a sample inventory from: http://paste.openstack.org/show/506999/
2- Execute the tool passing this inventory as parameter:

  $ devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/import_inventory.py inventory.yaml

For additional parameters use --help

Change-Id: Ia714445ab1ffb3e4b44580a0a262cd4d96944ce2

commit_message:
SSH brute force protection for cluster

This commit implements the same feature used for the Fuel master node
[0] with rate-limiting requests to SSH with iptables. The protection
used only when enabled and only for the not provided [1] networks.

[0] I0f452c8b0a808789aa4c2cd85d1d00556b210a39
[1] I34c9907d781b81253ed6942c67b16f8480de3bb5

DocImpact

Fix Nova noop tests for override_resources

The change I6be7bb4cea1906bd98c513bd2d01153e4643e3ac is switching
nova_config provider to openstackconfig which uses arrays for all values,
so tests should be updated accordingly

revisions:

Add the "--enable-port-security" and "--disable-port-security" options
to the "network create" and "network set" commands. This supports setting

Change-Id: I1deb505bd77cef2e4bc3c2dbbb0c450665136f47
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
'}]
commit_message:
Add port security option to network commands

Add the "--enable-port-security" and "--disable-port-security" options
to the "network create" and "network set" commands. This supports setting
the default port security for ports created on a network.

Change-Id: I1deb505bd77cef2e4bc3c2dbbb0c450665136f47
Implements: blueprint neutron-client

commit_message:
Disallow enbling a plugin with legacy tasks

When plugin contains legacy tasks enabling it makes no effect unless
propagate_task_deploy attribute is set. The plugin silently does
nothing. In order to avoid confusion enabling is prohibited explicitly.

Change-Id: I4acfb24de02ac4a5cfb25e9c8d5a3a03d5b58e77
Partial-Bug: 1596928

commit_message:
Fix chunked backup driver interface name

Chunked backup driver interface is wrongly named as
BackupDriverWithVerify. This patch renames it to
BackupChunkedDriver.

Change-Id: If0bdea9ac5ee9e38ab67e18f3ac517ccd3b010da

commit_message:
Add common code for node attributes

In order to facilitace adding different CLI commands for
managing different attributes of nodes there is a need to
add some common code that will allow to store and load
attributes along with the code that allow to find proper
file path to them.

Change-Id: I82e61de64f75a582f2ca49bfde08fda041586f04

subject: Enable 'at-least-once' and 'at-most-once' delivery modes in Engine
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-11 09:32:23.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/tasks.py', 'mistral/engine/rpc/ack_patterns.py', 'mistral/engine/actions.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_environment.py', 'mistral/engine/rpc/rpc.py'], 'message': "Enable 'at-least-once' and 'at-most-once' delivery modes in Engine

With this change parameter 'safe_rerun' is passed from Task as default
value (false) to Action and then to rpc layer. Next patch will add new
field 'safe_rerun' in task spec that would be available to end user. It's
value would be passed to Action.

Next steps:
* Enable end user to use both delivery modes

Partially implements blueprint mistral-task-delivery-model

Change-Id: I7f83313c23a1cb424ade8163ced54112491c3812
"}]
commit_message:
Enable 'at-least-once' and 'at-most-once' delivery modes in Engine

With this change parameter 'safe_rerun' is passed from Task as default
value (false) to Action and then to rpc layer. Next patch will add new
field 'safe_rerun' in task spec that would be available to end user. It's
value would be passed to Action.

Next steps:
* Enable end user to use both delivery modes

Partially implements blueprint mistral-task-delivery-model

Change-Id: I7f83313c23a1cb424ade8163ced54112491c3812

Next steps:

* Enable end user to use both delivery modes

Partially implements blueprint mistral-task-delivery-model

Change-Id: I4a0a66407d0c7f7eccfa47a33c42794c406118b6
"}]
commit_message:
Enable 'at-least-once' and 'at-most-once' delivery modes in RPC layer

Next steps:
* Enable both delivery modes in mistral engine
* Enable end user to use both delivery modes

Partially implements blueprint mistral-task-delivery-model

Change-Id: I4a0a66407d0c7f7eccfa47a33c42794c406118b6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 15:51:44.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/README.md'], 'message': "Change the example in README.md

Recently there was patch merged in lbaas which will not start q-lbaav2
if octavia driver is used.

example:

ENABLED_SERVICES+=,q-lbaasv2
ENABLED_SERVICES+=,octavia,o-cw,o-hk,o-hm,o-api

according to change this will not work in local.conf. It won't start
lbaasv2 actually. So this should be changed.

Change-Id: I0d5cd71a4373898a56ec741a106222b077cfcf34
Closes-Bug: #1516064
"}]
commit_message:
Change the example in README.md

Recently there was patch merged in lbaas which will not start q-lbaav2
if octavia driver is used.

example:

ENABLED_SERVICES+=,q-lbaasv2
ENABLED_SERVICES+=,octavia,o-cw,o-hk,o-hm,o-api

according to change this will not work in local.conf. It won't start
lbaasv2 actually. So this should be changed.

Change-Id: I0d5cd71a4373898a56ec741a106222b077cfcf34
Closes-Bug: #1516064

commit_message:
Remove leftover neutron restart from controller post-deploy stage

Since neutron.conf file is not updated anymore with valid value
of nova_admin_tenant_id, the restart of neutron server in post
deployment stage of upgrade operation is not needed.

Remove command that restarts neutron server.

Change-Id: I4e2ebe49221c0d0f02609d68cb343e2a707c5bad
Related-bug: 1584746

commit_message:
Add non-root ssh connection

Since fuel 9.0 clusters have non-root service user. This patch adds
logic that allows connecting to slaves with such credentials if cluster
have non-root support.

Change-Id: Iac4ac168022de7e60c40494841ac34d70f6f7986
Partial-Bug: #1575477

commit_message:
Separate restoring of release in ReleaseArchivator

The part that is responsible for restoring of an appropriate release
was separated from NailgunArchivator into ReleaseArchivator.

Also _post_restore_actions was decomposed on two separate functions:
  - _repair_database_consistency
  - _create_links_on_remote_logs

Change-Id: I4a91fe8db962f45f8b2050e4772d2aafaf2060ff

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-10 11:09:29.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/common/cliutils.py'], 'message': "Prints  '-' instead of 'None' when data is None

Client prints 'None' when data is None , and client also prints
'None' when data is a string 'None'. But string 'None' is  different
to None. To clear the confusion, Client should print '-' instead of
'None' when data is None. Nova Client and Cinder Client has cleared
the confusion.

Change-Id: I5b7013eb7ccfb99658702066191feed93f82fb8a
Related-Bug: #1600553
Closed-Bug: #1422244
"}]
commit_message:
Prints  '-' instead of 'None' when data is None

Client prints 'None' when data is None , and client also prints
'None' when data is a string 'None'. But string 'None' is  different
to None. To clear the confusion, Client should print '-' instead of
'None' when data is None. Nova Client and Cinder Client has cleared
the confusion.

Change-Id: I5b7013eb7ccfb99658702066191feed93f82fb8a
Related-Bug: #1600553
Closed-Bug: #1422244

commit_message:

This avoids creating the full table of the old Ceilometer alarms stuff on fresh
install, while upgrade will just ignore them.

commit_message:
[Django 1.10] django.conf.urls.patterns() removed

Django 1.10 removes django.conf.urls.patterns(). This patch fixes
the issue in the 2 places Horizon uses it.

Change-Id: I435d18ab02d0cb39682344f8fa98c49250ecb257
Partially-Implements: blueprint dj110

ssh access and the VM migration will be impossible. This change

Closes-Bug: #1604668
'}]
commit_message:
/run/nologin file removal

When the /run/nologin file exists, the pam_nologin module will block
ssh access and the VM migration will be impossible. This change
removes the file if it exists.

Change-Id: Ibdf216b5cdca59ddd261d5e4a747837171939ee8
Closes-Bug: #1604668

subject: openstack-core resource does not have interleave=true
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-15 12:08:27.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'openstack-core resource does not have interleave=true

The dummy openstack-core resource was meant to replace keystone so that
restarting keystone would not restart the whole cloud. When this
resource was introduced the paramter interleave=true was mistakenly left
out.

This causes a simple promote operation on the galera resource to restart
openstack-core and its children.

Change-Id: Ic590005a9419be87e6e6ea131b0ac0630c5afc19
Closes-Bug: 1603381
'}]
commit_message:
openstack-core resource does not have interleave=true

The dummy openstack-core resource was meant to replace keystone so that
restarting keystone would not restart the whole cloud. When this
resource was introduced the paramter interleave=true was mistakenly left
out.

This causes a simple promote operation on the galera resource to restart
openstack-core and its children.

Change-Id: Ic590005a9419be87e6e6ea131b0ac0630c5afc19
Closes-Bug: 1603381

anymore.

subject: Ensure queue exists before get/update the claim
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-07 02:36:49.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/tests/unit/storage/test_impl_redis.py', 'zaqar/storage/redis/claims.py'], 'message': 'Ensure queue exists before get/update the claim

Now with redis backend, if the queue is deleted, the request to
claim is still work and will return some unexpected result, such
as 503 error.
So we should ensure the queue exists before get/update the claim.

Change-Id: I324e342b0ec49ca2b6aa48e371fc818a53ac1ffb
Closes-bug: #1591921
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure queue exists before get/update the claim

Now with redis backend, if the queue is deleted, the request to
claim is still work and will return some unexpected result, such
as 503 error.
So we should ensure the queue exists before get/update the claim.

Change-Id: I324e342b0ec49ca2b6aa48e371fc818a53ac1ffb
Closes-bug: #1591921

subject: Add map_replace spec
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-19 07:24:59.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/map-replace-function.rst'], 'message': 'Add map_replace spec

Adds a spec for a proposed new intrinsic function.

This is required by TripleO to enable transforming a mapping of
service names to networks, where we have two maps, one of service
names to network names, and another (per node) of network names
to IP addresses.

Change-Id: Id5edeeffd22365479fca537a6044cee31a8272bb
'}]
commit_message:
Add map_replace spec

Adds a spec for a proposed new intrinsic function.

This is required by TripleO to enable transforming a mapping of
service names to networks, where we have two maps, one of service
names to network names, and another (per node) of network names
to IP addresses.

Change-Id: Id5edeeffd22365479fca537a6044cee31a8272bb

subject: Change glance-store name to match launchpad project
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-18 18:54:28.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Change glance-store name to match launchpad project

When glance-store was created in launchpad [1], we could not create a
project with '_' in it's name due to launchpad constraints.

This commit modifies the reference to reflect the name of the project to
match that of the launchpad name. This is also important as the release
team refers to the project to match the launchpad name and then asks for
the repo name separately. `glance-store` launchpad project uses
openstack/glance_store repo [2] for it's development.

This governance change is thus required to unblock release of the
glance_store library.

Release team README [3] referring launchpad project name requirement as
of July 18th 2016.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance-store
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/glance_store/
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/releases/tree/README.rst#n153

Change-Id: Idd3f57672466b894d4f33be1a22a4e725e562970
"}]
commit_message:
Change glance-store name to match launchpad project

When glance-store was created in launchpad [1], we could not create a
project with '_' in it's name due to launchpad constraints.

This commit modifies the reference to reflect the name of the project to
match that of the launchpad name. This is also important as the release
team refers to the project to match the launchpad name and then asks for
the repo name separately. `glance-store` launchpad project uses
openstack/glance_store repo [2] for it's development.

This governance change is thus required to unblock release of the
glance_store library.

Release team README [3] referring launchpad project name requirement as
of July 18th 2016.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance-store
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/glance_store/
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/releases/tree/README.rst#n153

Change-Id: Idd3f57672466b894d4f33be1a22a4e725e562970

commit_message:
Repurpose KeystoneWorkers add keystone::wsgi::apache::threads

Now that keystone is run with wsgi apache the KeystoneWorkers
param has no efffect [1]. This repurposes KeystoneWorkers to now
set wsgi::apache::workers and adds the
keystone::wsgi::apache::threads hardcoding to 1 (can overrride
via extraconfig data)

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-keystone/blob/51c68fb127c28b9748b352871783c3ec6ef5c83b/manifests/init.pp#L396

Closes-Bug: 1598092
Change-Id: I503d1f0d3f4c56abfaf4609ea8290e78668013b6

subject: Always install nodejs from nodesource
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-19 22:55:54.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': 'Always install nodejs from nodesource

It appears that the xenial LTS packages are not staying up-to-date
with the latest LTS releases of NodeJS and NPM. This patch removes the
distro condition that toggles installs, instead relying on the upstream
package we use from NodeSource directly.

Change-Id: I273ebcf85f8fcb09938149a2e30e22fbbbd96dd5
'}]
commit_message:
Always install nodejs from nodesource

It appears that the xenial LTS packages are not staying up-to-date
with the latest LTS releases of NodeJS and NPM. This patch removes the
distro condition that toggles installs, instead relying on the upstream
package we use from NodeSource directly.

Change-Id: I273ebcf85f8fcb09938149a2e30e22fbbbd96dd5

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-19 13:00:07.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/keystone-install.rst'], 'message': "Fix installation of keystone in debian and ubuntu

Following the separation of the Debconf install guide, this patch
updates the installation procedure for Keystone in both Debian and
Ubuntu.

Both distros aren't providing startup files anymore, as upstream
removed support for eventlet: both Debian and Ubuntu are now
providing a directly useable keystone Apache2 configuration, though
only Debian goes the extra mile and activates wgsi + keystone
automatically in the postinst script.

Change-Id: I9a2c973a28801b61e7617a889961bcbf66307482
"}]
commit_message:
Fix installation of keystone in debian and ubuntu

Following the separation of the Debconf install guide, this patch
updates the installation procedure for Keystone in both Debian and
Ubuntu.

Both distros aren't providing startup files anymore, as upstream
removed support for eventlet: both Debian and Ubuntu are now
providing a directly useable keystone Apache2 configuration, though
only Debian goes the extra mile and activates wgsi + keystone
automatically in the postinst script.

Change-Id: I9a2c973a28801b61e7617a889961bcbf66307482

subject: Add shared vlan type driver
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-07-20 03:15:41.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/common/constants.py', 'tricircle/network/drivers/type_shared_vlan.py', 'tricircle/network/managers.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_plugin.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'setup.cfg', 'tricircle/network/plugin.py', 'tricircle/nova_apigw/controllers/server.py'], 'message': "Add shared vlan type driver

1. What is the problem
Network type framework has been merged but only the local network
type is supported currently, so cross-pod l2 networking is still
not available.

2. What is the solution to the problem
At the first step, we support the simplest shared vlan network
type. VMs in different pods are hosted in the network of its own
pod with the same vlan ID and are connected with physical switches.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
(1) A shared vlan type driver is added.
(2) During the process of VM creation, if Nova_apigw finds that
the required network is shared vlan type, it uses all the segment
information of the network to form a network creation request and
sends it to the Neutron server in the bottom pod with admin token.
(3) The creation of bridge network for cross-pod l3 networking
directly uses shared vlan type driver, no longer requires extra
codes to allocate segments.

To fully complete functional shared vlan network type, it's necessary
to add functionality of port creation for gateway in each pod. But this
patch set does not cover this functionality because of complexities.

Change-Id: I8dd75d51fb74340c03d44e007b217f70d1a12d66
"}]
commit_message:
Add shared vlan type driver

1. What is the problem
Network type framework has been merged but only the local network
type is supported currently, so cross-pod l2 networking is still
not available.

2. What is the solution to the problem
At the first step, we support the simplest shared vlan network
type. VMs in different pods are hosted in the network of its own
pod with the same vlan ID and are connected with physical switches.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
(1) A shared vlan type driver is added.
(2) During the process of VM creation, if Nova_apigw finds that
the required network is shared vlan type, it uses all the segment
information of the network to form a network creation request and
sends it to the Neutron server in the bottom pod with admin token.
(3) The creation of bridge network for cross-pod l3 networking
directly uses shared vlan type driver, no longer requires extra
codes to allocate segments.

To fully complete functional shared vlan network type, it's necessary
to add functionality of port creation for gateway in each pod. But this
patch set does not cover this functionality because of complexities.

Change-Id: I8dd75d51fb74340c03d44e007b217f70d1a12d66

commit_message:
Adds ability to set a custom theme

Adds variable horizon_theme to allow a deployer to set a
custom theme. The value is used to set CUSTOM_THEME_PATH in
local_settings.py and can be a full path to a theme on the
file system and defaults to the default theme in horizon.

Change-Id: Id7b667a9fc9f9e3066f05a131a70dbf83a3326c3
Closes-Bug: 1590839

revisions:

Deployers can now configure their own custom

Horizon configuration values AVAILABLE_THEMES and
DEFAULT_THEME

See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/settings.html#available-themes

Change-Id: I90b1cb45c851eb654638d82b83af56f93a642895
Closes-Bug: #1590839

commit_message:
Add support for custom Horizon themes

Deployers can now configure their own custom
themes and set them as the default theme using the
Horizon configuration values AVAILABLE_THEMES and
DEFAULT_THEME

See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/settings.html#available-themes
for further details on the configuration.

Change-Id: I90b1cb45c851eb654638d82b83af56f93a642895
Closes-Bug: #1590839

commit_message:
Use osd-upgrade user for pause/resume

The pause and resume actions shell out to the ceph command to run
OSD operations (in/out).

Because the default cephx key given out by the monitor cluster does
not contain the correct permissions, these commands fail.

Use the osd-upgrade user which has the correct permissions.

Closes-Bug: 1602826

Depends-On: I6af43b61149c6eeeeb5c77950701194beda2da71
Change-Id: I95bedcdea622fbf2fd799e63932cedd0d577568a

commit_message:
Use osd-upgrade user for pause/resume

The pause and resume actions shell out to the ceph command to run
OSD operations (in/out).

Because the default cephx key given out by the monitor cluster does
not contain the correct permissions, these commands fail.

Use the osd-upgrade user which has the correct permissions.

Closes-Bug: 1602826

Depends-On: I6af43b61149c6eeeeb5c77950701194beda2da71
Change-Id: Ie31bc9048972dbb0986ac8deb5b821a4db5d585f

commit_message:
Use constraints for coverage job

job to check that the recent changes for zuul-cloner work correctly.

Use constraints for cover environment.

commit_message:
Introduce microversion-parse package

We were doing some parsing of the micro-version header by ourselves
while there is a community wide package doing the same thing. This patch
proposes a migration to use the 'microversion-parse' package for this
job.

Change-Id: I47b7021509e24a9f103a494a97fe50d8dfb99b7c

subject: Fix the issue introduced by Neutron in _add_network_segment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 01:42:37.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/network/managers.py'], 'message': 'Fix the issue introduced by Neutron in _add_network_segment

1.What is the problem
The Tricircle Neutron plugin will call Neutron type manager's
function _add_network_segement, the first parameter of this
function was "session" in the past, but Neutron has changed
the parameter to "context" recently, this makes the check
and gate test in the Tricircle failed because the Tricircle
still pass "session" as the first parameter.

All check and gate test of python27 failed due to this change,
and any new patch is not able to be merged. The issue should
be fixed ASAP.

2.What's need to be fixed:
Pass "context" but not "session" to the function
_add_network_segement.

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
To get rid of the failure in check and gate test failure.

Change-Id: I78c64fe3cdd939cbdecf35fec0cff6cb44746cb0
Signed-off-by: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the issue introduced by Neutron in _add_network_segment

1.What is the problem
The Tricircle Neutron plugin will call Neutron type manager's
function _add_network_segement, the first parameter of this
function was "session" in the past, but Neutron has changed
the parameter to "context" recently, this makes the check
and gate test in the Tricircle failed because the Tricircle
still pass "session" as the first parameter.

All check and gate test of python27 failed due to this change,
and any new patch is not able to be merged. The issue should
be fixed ASAP.

2.What's need to be fixed:
Pass "context" but not "session" to the function
_add_network_segement.

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
To get rid of the failure in check and gate test failure.

Change-Id: I78c64fe3cdd939cbdecf35fec0cff6cb44746cb0
Signed-off-by: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Pass auth_token in auth_ref

In our env, keystone was looking for auth_token inside auth_ref
while trying to construct the client. This resulted in an exception.
This patch fixed the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1604532

Change-Id: I101cf72f61dd824cb62f7f2b6d42ade6e7f3b1c3

commit_message:
Fix the failure to create instance snapshot

When making snapshot for instance with ceph enabled, nova will use
upate image api to create the snapshot directly. with the patchset
I7284dee828bc8ca00747bc7668b37fa7176afc85 in Glance, the
show_multiple_locations must be True.

Change-Id: Ic9612566e2ab8f641030fef97b519f11d942a915
Closes-Bug: #1604464

commit_message:
Add a hacking rule for string interpolation at logging

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled
by the logging code, rather than being done
at the point of the logging call.
So add a hacking rule for it.

See the oslo i18n guideline.

* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Change-Id: I91e8d59d508c594256d5f74514e62f8f928d1df5
Closes-Bug: #1596829

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-15 00:06:54.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/fake_hpe_client_exceptions.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_fc.py'], 'message': '3par driver handles concurrent host create conflict

One of the step in creating a FC VLUN is to create a host on array.
When there happens to have simultaneous request for creating same host,
hpe3parclient will create host for one and return HTTP 409 conflict for others,
with error code 73, message "host WWN/iSCSI name already used by another host".
This was not handled by 3PAR driver and the HTTP exception would propagate up to
volume manager where it would log it. This patch addresses this bug by catching

Change-Id: I66e4f80696c782ab869ef0d7848fc6f3b3100c04
Closes-Bug: #1597454

commit_message:
3par driver handles concurrent host create conflict

One of the step in creating a FC VLUN is to create a host on array.
When there happens to have simultaneous request for creating same host,
hpe3parclient will create host for one and return HTTP 409 conflict for others,
with error code 73, message "host WWN/iSCSI name already used by another host".
This was not handled by 3PAR driver and the HTTP exception would propagate up to
volume manager where it would log it. This patch addresses this bug by catching
this exception and reusing the same host.

Change-Id: I66e4f80696c782ab869ef0d7848fc6f3b3100c04
Closes-Bug: #1597454

subject: Support newer mysql in tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 00:58:31.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/db/migrations.py'], 'message': "Support newer mysql in tests

Newer mysql cli clients emit a warning when you put a password on the
cli. This warning was being interpreted as a failure by the test
framework. Change the framework to accept the warning or empty string as
valid responses when running the mysql cli client to support using the
cli client in the trove tests.

I am not entirely sure when this new behavior arrived in mysql but it is
present in Ubuntu Xenial's Mysql 5.7 packages.

Change-Id: Ia148d72a7646f4c424139232d6388ff14d1d8686
"}]
commit_message:
Support newer mysql in tests

Newer mysql cli clients emit a warning when you put a password on the
cli. This warning was being interpreted as a failure by the test
framework. Change the framework to accept the warning or empty string as
valid responses when running the mysql cli client to support using the
cli client in the trove tests.

I am not entirely sure when this new behavior arrived in mysql but it is
present in Ubuntu Xenial's Mysql 5.7 packages.

Change-Id: Ia148d72a7646f4c424139232d6388ff14d1d8686

subject: Serialize py34 tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-19 18:43:29.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Serialize py34 tests

It turns out that the way the python34 tests are run in parallel is
to spin up several processes (not threads).  This means that putting
locks around creating the database in a single 'run' would need an
inter-process lock not a thread lock.

While the feasibility of this is investigated, change the behaviour
of the tests to run in series to increase stability.

On a 4 cpu test machine this only increased the run time by 70s.

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3

Change-Id: I530fcf22b697148a3d0a286015c5a79481528d8e
"}]
commit_message:
Serialize py34 tests

It turns out that the way the python34 tests are run in parallel is
to spin up several processes (not threads).  This means that putting
locks around creating the database in a single 'run' would need an
inter-process lock not a thread lock.

While the feasibility of this is investigated, change the behaviour
of the tests to run in series to increase stability.

On a 4 cpu test machine this only increased the run time by 70s.

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3

Change-Id: I530fcf22b697148a3d0a286015c5a79481528d8e

need to explicitly do this.

commit_message:
Config: no need to set default=None

By default oslo.cfg sets the default value as None. There is no
need to explicitly do this.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I98ec529947e922bd610292c7d02c97e197e8b7d8

commit_message:
Blacklist oslo.context 2.6.0

The 2.6.0 release has an API change to the RequestContext
class init:

d3af1d06b4046c25c199bf1c389a9e440a634bc6

That's breaking nova jobs now that upper-constraints is using
2.6.0.

That change needs to be coordinated, and it should have triggered
a major version bump for oslo.context.

Change-Id: I9d0e19efa950192103de5ddf6326fa481d00688f
Related-Bug: #1603979

commit_message:
Add is_admin_project to context

is_admin_project is provided by keystonemiddleware and used by
oslo.policy to enforce that a project scoped token exists in the admin
project.

To make this usable we add the ability to read the X-Is-Admin-Project
header from the environment, and add it to the outputted policy values.

Note the value is added to keystonemiddleware in the depend review
however it must work even with older auth_token middlewares so is fine
to merge prior to a middleware release.

Closes-Bug: #1577996
Depends-On: Ic680e6eaa683926914cf4b2152ec3bb67c6601ff
Change-Id: Ie48fedb8092e33e9645a37ea3fe44b88d34ad3b8

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-09 16:21:09.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/guides/single-machine.rst'], 'message': 'WIP: Switch doc to use to neutron by default.

Change I1304a605fc4b1a832036bd98b5bfd0d630d6fe56 in the Nova
project officially deprecates nova networking and encourages a shift to
neutron networks instead.  This is due to OpenStack User Survey feedback
that less than 10% of users are still utilizing nova networks.

Given this signaling, it seems appropriate to update the devstack
documentation to default to neutron networking.

Change-Id: Iec63cb5755f31c20fde15fc911b816169764fea5
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Switch doc to use to neutron by default.

Change I1304a605fc4b1a832036bd98b5bfd0d630d6fe56 in the Nova
project officially deprecates nova networking and encourages a shift to
neutron networks instead.  This is due to OpenStack User Survey feedback
that less than 10% of users are still utilizing nova networks.

Given this signaling, it seems appropriate to update the devstack
documentation to default to neutron networking.

Change-Id: Iec63cb5755f31c20fde15fc911b816169764fea5

Correct reraising of exception

when an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 13:02:10.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/repo_build/templates/requirements_constraints.txt.j2'], 'message': 'Fix the computed constraints

The current constraints file is generated from a template, which
completely recreates the url used for the constraints.
Therefore, it deletes previously given arguments, like subdirectories.

This commit replaces the initial url to the local (previously fetched)
repo, so the constraints generation behavior stays consistent.

Change-Id: I5fe202ddb38b99e4631bfc40fc360cfd5702d993
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(Ported from commit 474db96286b06597cbda4736c939f51b594dafa3)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the computed constraints

The current constraints file is generated from a template, which
completely recreates the url used for the constraints.
Therefore, it deletes previously given arguments, like subdirectories.

This commit replaces the initial url to the local (previously fetched)
repo, so the constraints generation behavior stays consistent.

Change-Id: I5fe202ddb38b99e4631bfc40fc360cfd5702d993
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(Ported from commit 474db96286b06597cbda4736c939f51b594dafa3)

subject: Fix show/hide password when clicking password icon
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-19 00:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.users.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/components/_forms.scss'], 'message': "Fix show/hide password when clicking password icon

This patch overrides a Bootstrap's default property that disables
mouse events on elements with .form-control-feedback class. The password
icon had pointer-events: none; affecting password reveal functionality
in login form and Identity->Users->Create User. It also modifies the default
cursor for the password icon with pointer.

This patch also fixes a bug where the Eye Icon is misaligned when passwords
don't match (See #1604196)

Change-Id: I052321a5cc9adc1a7ffdfce4da0b55c245481a2d
Closes-bug: #1593430
Closes-bug: #1604196
"}]
commit_message:
Fix show/hide password when clicking password icon

This patch overrides a Bootstrap's default property that disables
mouse events on elements with .form-control-feedback class. The password
icon had pointer-events: none; affecting password reveal functionality
in login form and Identity->Users->Create User. It also modifies the default
cursor for the password icon with pointer.

This patch also fixes a bug where the Eye Icon is misaligned when passwords
don't match (See #1604196)

Change-Id: I052321a5cc9adc1a7ffdfce4da0b55c245481a2d
Closes-bug: #1593430
Closes-bug: #1604196

commit_message:
Use SAML2 requests plugin

This is a major refactoring of the SAML2 plugin to move the logic into a
standalone requests auth plugin, and then have the keystoneauth plugin
simply provide a wrapper around that.

There was really no way to migrate this and keep the existing test files
as they were because the entire structure has been changed.

This will be the recommended way to do federation plugins in future and
keep the auth logic out of keystoneauth as much as possible (as kerberos
already does).

The intention will be that later we should be able to extract the SAML
ECP requests plugin into it's own upstream module.

Change-Id: I4a7377b9350741e8f7a4ed2a49a7e2442eacdd23

commit_message:
Console log copy for block live migration

Fix problem of console log file lost during
block live migration by copying this file
from destination using scp and then swap with
console.log created by libvirt.

Change-Id: Ib026009be41744ab6057133493829b8e9e61972d
Closes-Bug: #1203193

Since the AZ cache creates more problems than it resolves, we prefer to remove it
from the AZ helper module.
To be clear, there are a few problems with the cache :
 - it's keyed by hosts, not by instances but since an instance can have no hosts
   related to it (for example, when it's not scheduled), it creates some confusion
 - if an instance is not yet scheduled, it returns the default AZ while it should
   return None instead
 - the above creates some bugs with flapping AZs for some instances (see bug #1390033)
 - there is no real beating reason for using a MC for getting something internal
   (in an helper module) while it could maybe be far more appealing either close
   to the model or to the API

Change-Id: Id59faf5a0c04569963e9a46b7575dae108546727
"}]
commit_message:
Remove cache from the AZ helper

Since the AZ cache creates more problems than it resolves, we prefer to remove it
from the AZ helper module.
To be clear, there are a few problems with the cache :
 - it's keyed by hosts, not by instances but since an instance can have no hosts
   related to it (for example, when it's not scheduled), it creates some confusion
 - if an instance is not yet scheduled, it returns the default AZ while it should
   return None instead
 - the above creates some bugs with flapping AZs for some instances (see bug #1390033)
 - there is no real beating reason for using a MC for getting something internal
   (in an helper module) while it could maybe be far more appealing either close
   to the model or to the API

Change-Id: Id59faf5a0c04569963e9a46b7575dae108546727

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-11 14:09:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/test_linux_net.py', 'nova/network/linux_net.py'], 'message': "linux_net: retry ovs vif port creation

When a host is rebooted and resume_guests_state_on_host_boot is set
to True, it may happen that nova-compute starts before OVS finishes
initialization of all created bridges, and thus we'll see the
following error when creating an ovs vif port:

    ovs-vsctl: no bridge named br-int

An instance will be booted successfully, but there will be no network
connectivity inside the VM.

In init systems like upstart this dependency between services can not
be expressed easily as the fact OVS started does not mean it has
finished its initialization and created all necessary bridges. We
would need an explicit notification sent by OVS to ensure all edge
cases are covered.

Retry an ovs vif port creation to give OVS some time to complete its
initialization.

Closes-Bug: #1532890

Change-Id: I5d3815c403098b2071da0ede21208ab7dc358edb
"}]
commit_message:
linux_net: retry ovs vif port creation

When a host is rebooted and resume_guests_state_on_host_boot is set
to True, it may happen that nova-compute starts before OVS finishes
initialization of all created bridges, and thus we'll see the
following error when creating an ovs vif port:

    ovs-vsctl: no bridge named br-int

An instance will be booted successfully, but there will be no network
connectivity inside the VM.

In init systems like upstart this dependency between services can not
be expressed easily as the fact OVS started does not mean it has
finished its initialization and created all necessary bridges. We
would need an explicit notification sent by OVS to ensure all edge
cases are covered.

Retry an ovs vif port creation to give OVS some time to complete its
initialization.

Closes-Bug: #1532890

Change-Id: I5d3815c403098b2071da0ede21208ab7dc358edb

commit_message:
Require privsep-based os-brick

This change moves to a version of os-brick sufficient to include the
rootwrap->privsep transition and removes the now-obsolete os-brick
rootwrap filters.

Change-Id: I2bfd002d5b619164ee5779063ba52076716de542
Depends-On: I0af542eba97d2f89b1c283bf1e1e985d9690f5de
Implements: blueprint privsep

commit_message:
Use constraints for coverage job

OpenStack CI supports now constraints in the coverage job - as a first
job to check that recent changes for zuul-cloner work correctly.

Use constraints for cover environment. If this works successfully, the
other environments can be updated in followups.

Change-Id: I6069bee0a89d38f6a3ec57418e7bda9850dc6f64
(cherry picked from commit 1a95ac48b757a7d3050339fe72837f71f0351d74)

commit_message:
Pass request to v2 token authenticate

The v2 authenticate command is one of the last to still accept a context
dict because it has a lot of tie in with tests and notifications. Fix
all these so that authenticate can work with a request.

Change-Id: I07a2985fea7f71001c4a48d396167ea0e3a2a8f8
